Quote: “I am made of memories.”
Author: Madeline Miller,

Quote: “We are just an advanced breed of monkeys on a minor planet of a very average star. But we can understand the Universe. That makes us something very special.”
Author: Stephen Hawking

Quote: “Don't stop there. I suppose there are also, what, vampires and werewolves and zombies?Of course there are. Although you mostly find zombies farther south, where the voudun priests are.What about mummies? Do they only hang around Egypt?Don't be ridiculous. No one believes in mummies.”
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quote: “Say 'provoking' again. Your mouth looks provocative when you do.”
Author: Becca Fitzpatrick,

Quote: “You will do foolish things, but do them with enthusiasm.”
Author: Colette

Quote: “Success is getting what you want, happiness is wanting what you get”
Author: W.P. Kinsella

Quote: “I nodded, looking at Rachel with respect. You hit the Lord of the Titans in the eye with a blue plastic hairbrush.”
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: “I cannot teach anybody anything. I can only make them think”
Author: Socrates

Quote: “The best moments in reading are when you come across something – a thought, a feeling, a way of looking at things – which you had thought special and particular to you. Now here it is, set down by someone else, a person you have never met, someone even who is long dead. And it is as if a hand has c...
Author: Alan Bennett,

Quote: “I woke up thinking a very pleasant thought. There is lots left in the world to read.”
Author: Nicholson Baker,

Quote: “Let us learn to show our friendship for a man when he is alive and not after he is dead.”
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,

Quote: “Maybe...you'll fall in love with me all over again.Hell, I said, I love you enough now. What do you want to do? Ruin me?Yes. I want to ruin you.Good, I said. That's what I want too.”
Author: Ernest Hemingway,

Quote: “People say that life is the thing, but I prefer reading.”
Author: Logan Pearsall Smith

Quote: “We must be willing to let go of the life we planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us.”
Author: Joseph Campbell

Quote: “If you want to tell people the truth, make them laugh, otherwise they'll kill you.”
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: “Live in the present, remember the past, and fear not the future, for it doesn't exist and never shall. There is only now.”
Author: Christopher Paolini,

Quote: “If you want to be a writer, you must do two things above all others: read a lot and write a lot.”
Author: Stephen King

Quote: “That it will never come again is what makes life so sweet.”
Author: Emily Dickinson

Quote: “Behind every exquisite thing that existed, there was something tragic.”
Author: Oscar Wilde,

Quote: “If you treat an individual as he is, he will remain how he is. But if you treat him as if he were what he ought to be and could be, he will become what he ought to be and could be.”
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: “And when at last you find someone to whom you feel you can pour out your soul, you stop in shock at the words you utter— they are so rusty, so ugly, so meaningless and feeble from being kept in the small cramped dark inside you so long.”
Author: Sylvia Plath,
Book: The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

Quote: “Men are afraid that women will laugh at them. Women are afraid that men will kill them.”
Author: Margaret Atwood

Quote: “I can shake off everything as I write; my sorrows disappear, my courage is reborn.”
Author: Anne Frank

Quote: “And when her lips met mine, I knew that I could live to be a hundred and visit every country in the world, but nothing would ever compare to that single moment when I first kissed the girl of my dreams and knew that my love would last forever.”
Author: Nicholas Sparks,

Quote: “Happiness [is] only real when shared”
Author: Jon Krakauer,

Quote: “When he died, all things soft and beautiful and bright would be buried with him.”
Author: Madeline Miller,

Quote: “What and how much had I lost by trying to do only what was expected of me instead of what I myself had wished to do?”
Author: Ralph Ellison,

Quote: “I love you like a fat kid loves cake!”
Author: Scott Adams

Quote: “To be, or not to be: that is the question:Whether 'tis nobler in the mind to sufferThe slings and arrows of outrageous fortune,Or to take arms against a sea of troubles,And by opposing end them? To die: to sleep;No more; and by a sleep to say we endThe heart-ache and the thousand natural shocksThat...
Author: William Shakespeare,

Quote: “Have you ever noticed that anybody driving slower than you is an idiot, and anyone going faster than you is a maniac?”
Author: George Carlin

Quote: “When it is dark enough, you can see the stars.”
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: “You won’t understand what I mean now, but someday you will: the only trick of friendship, I think, is to find people who are better than you are—not smarter, not cooler, but kinder, and more generous, and more forgiving—and then to appreciate them for what they can teach you, and to try to listen t...
Author: Hanya Yanagihara,

Quote: “So it's you and a syringe against the Capitol? See, this is why no one lets you make the plans.”
Author: Suzanne Collins,

Quote: “You think your pain and your heartbreak are unprecedented in the history of the world, but then you read.”
Author: James Baldwin

Quote: “Though she be but little, she is fierce!”
Author: William Shakespeare,

Quote: “Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak.”
Author: Sun Tzu,

Quote: “It was not the feeling of completeness I so needed, but the feeling of not being empty.”
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,

Quote: “Is 'fat' really the worst thing a human being can be? Is 'fat' worse than 'vindictive', 'jealous', 'shallow', 'vain', 'boring' or 'cruel'? Not to me.”
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: “Education is the ability to listen to almost anything without losing your temper or your self-confidence.”
Author: Robert Frost

Quote: “You can't measure the mutual affection of two human beings by the number of words they exchange.”
Author: Milan Kundera

Quote: “You must make a decision that you are going to move on. It wont happen automatically. You will have to rise up and say, ‘I don’t care how hard this is, I don’t care how disappointed I am, I’m not going to let this get the best of me. I’m moving on with my life.”
Author: Joel Osteen,
Book: Your Best Life Now: 7 Steps to Living at Your Full Potential

Quote: “Welcome to the wonderful world of jealousy, he thought. For the price of admission, you get a splitting headache, a nearly irresistable urge to commit murder, and an inferiority complex. Yippee.”
Author: J.R. Ward,

Quote: “Cowards die many times before their deaths; The valiant never taste of death but once. Of all the wonders that I yet have heard, It seems to me most strange that men should fear; Seeing that death, a necessary end, Will come when it will come.”
Author: William Shakespeare,

Quote: “There is no exquisite beauty… without some strangeness in the proportion.”
Author: Edgar Allan Poe

Quote: “What if it lines up like it did in the Trojan War ... Athena versus Poseidon?I don't know. But I just know that I'll be fighting next to you.Why?Because you're my friend, Seaweed Brain. Any more stupid questions?”
Author: Rick Riordan,

Quote: “Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don't resist them; that only creates sorrow. Let reality be reality. Let things flow naturally forward in whatever way they like.”
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: “Love is an untamed force. When we try to control it, it destroys us. When we try to imprison it, it enslaves us. When we try to understand it, it leaves us feeling lost and confused.”
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: “How do you spell 'love'? - PigletYou don't spell it...you feel it. - Pooh”
Author: A.A. Milne

Quote: “you can, you should, and if you’re brave enough to start, you will.”
Author: Stephen King,
Book: On Writing: A Memoir of the Craft

Quote: “‎Life is a shipwreck, but we must not forget to sing in the lifeboats.”
Author: Voltaire

Quote: “Reading furnishes the mind only with materials of knowledge; it is thinking that makes what we read ours.”
Author: John Locke

Quote: “What is that you express in your eyes? It seems to me more than all the print I have read in my life.”
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: “If we wait for the moment when everything, absolutely everything is ready, we shall never begin.”
Author: Ivan Turgenev

Quote: “Anyone whose goal is 'something higher' must expect someday to suffer vertigo. What is vertigo? Fear of falling? No, Vertigo is something other than fear of falling. It is the voice of the emptiness below us which tempts and lures us, it is the desire to fall, against which, terrified, we defend ou...
Author: Milan Kundera,

Quote: “Take pride in your pain; you are stronger than those who have none”
Author: Lois Lowry,

Quote: “All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does, and that is his.”
Author: Oscar Wilde,

Quote: “There are three rules for writing a novel. Unfortunately, no one knows what they are.”
Author: W. Somerset Maugham

Quote: “The only way to get rid of temptation is to yield to it.”
Author: Oscar Wilde,

Quote: “I fell in love with you, smartass, because you were one of us—because you weren’t afraid of me, and you decided to end your spectacular victory by throwing that piece of bone at Amarantha like a javelin. I felt Cassian’s spirit beside me in that moment, and could have sworn I heard him say, ‘If you...
Author: Sarah J. Maas,
Book: A Court of Mist and Fury

Quote: “Never say 'no' to adventures. Always say 'yes,' otherwise you'll lead a very dull life.”
Author: Ian Fleming

Quote: “Perhaps the greatest faculty our minds possess is the ability to cope with pain. Classic thinking teaches us of the four doors of the mind, which everyone moves through according to their need.First is the door of sleep. Sleep offers us a retreat from the world and all its pain. Sleep marks passing...
Author: Patrick Rothfuss,

Quote: “Do I contradict myself?Very well then I contradict myself,(I am large, I contain multitudes.)”
Author: Walt Whitman,

Quote: “Yeah, Quirrell was a great teacher. There was just that minor drawback of him having Lord Voldemort sticking out of the back of his head!”
Author: J.K. Rowling,
Book: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

Quote: “A ship is safe in harbor, but that's not what ships are for.”
Author: John A. Shedd

Quote: “Money can't buy happiness, but it can make you awfully comfortable while you're being miserable.”
Author: Clare Boothe Luce

Quote: “Every man I meet wants to protect me. I can't figure out what from.”
Author: Mae West

Quote: “Crying is all right in its way while it lasts. But you have to stop sooner or later, and then you still have to decide what to do.”
Author: C.S. Lewis,

Quote: “Every great love starts with a great story...”
Author: Nicholas Sparks,

Quote: “I could not tell you if I loved you the first moment I saw you, or if it was the second or third or fourth. But I remember the first moment I looked at you walking toward me and realized that somehow the rest of the world seemed to vanish when I was with you.”
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quote: “Life, he realize, was much like a song. In the beginning there is mystery, in the end there is confirmation, but it's in the middle where all the emotion resides to make the whole thing worthwhile.”
Author: Nicholas Sparks,

Quote: “And I thought about how many people have loved those songs. And how many people got through a lot of bad times because of those songs. And how many people enjoyed good times with those songs. And how much those songs really mean. I think it would be great to have written one of those songs. I bet i...
Author: Stephen Chbosky,
Book: The Perks of Being a Wallflower

Quote: “So you're always honest, I said.Aren't you?No, I told him. I'm not.Well, that's good to know, I guess.I'm not saying I'm a liar, I told him. He raised his eyebrows. That's not how I meant it, anyways.How'd you mean it, then?I just...I don't always say what I feel.Why not?Because the truth sometimes...
Author: Sarah Dessen,

Quote: “The meek may inherit the earth, but at the moment it belongs to the conceited. Like me.”
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quote: “The creatures outside looked from pig to man, and from man to pig, and from pig to man again; but already it was impossible to say which was which.”
Author: George Orwell,

Quote: “It's funny how humans can wrap their mind around things and fit them into their version of reality.”
Author: Rick Riordan,

Quote: “If you ask me what I came to do in this world, I, an artist, will answer you: I am here to live out loud.”
Author: Émile Zola

Quote: “You can cut all the flowers but you cannot keep Spring from coming.”
Author: Pablo Neruda

Quote: “I am too fond of reading books to care to write them.”
Author: Oscar Wilde,

Quote: “The only way to get through life is to laugh your way through it. You either have to laugh or cry. I prefer to laugh. Crying gives me a headache.”
Author: Marjorie Pay Hinckley

Quote: “Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.”
Author: Carl Gustav Jung

Quote: “Don't feel bad for one moment about doing what brings you joy.”
Author: Sarah J. Maas,
Book: A Court of Thorns and Roses

Quote: “Always find opportunities to make someone smile, and to offer random acts of kindness in everyday life.”
Author: Roy T. Bennett,

Quote: “Clary, Despite everything, I can't bear the thought of this ring being lost forever, any more then I can bear the thought of leaving you forever. And though I have no choice about the one, at least I can choose about the other. I'm leaving you our family ring because you have as much right to it as...
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quote: “The best thing for being sad, replied Merlin, beginning to puff and blow, is to learn something. That's the only thing that never fails. You may grow old and trembling in your anatomies, you may lie awake at night listening to the disorder of your veins, you may miss your only love, you may see the...
Author: T.H. White,

Quote: “You wanna fly, you got to give up the shit that weighs you down.”
Author: Toni Morrison,

Quote: “Rivers know this: there is no hurry. We shall get there some day.”
Author: A.A. Milne,

Quote: “Love is a temporary madness, it erupts like volcanoes and then subsides. And when it subsides, you have to make a decision. You have to work out whether your roots have so entwined together that it is inconceivable that you should ever part. Because this is what love is. Love is not breathlessness,...
Author: Shawn Slovo,

Quote: “They’re not hideous,” said Tessa. Will blinked at her. “What?” “Gideon and Gabriel,” said Tessa. “They’re really quite good-looking, not hideous at all.” “I spoke,” said Will, in sepulchral tones, “of the pitch-black inner depths of their souls.” Tessa snorted. “And what color do you suppose the in...
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quote: “So many things are possible just as long as you don't know they're impossible.”
Author: Norton Juster,

Quote: “And then he gives me a smile that just seems so genuinely sweet with just the right touch of shyness that unexpected warmth rushes through me.”
Author: Suzanne Collins,

Quote: “Raise your words, not voice. It is rain that grows flowers, not thunder.”
Author: Rumi

Quote: “Be clearly aware of the stars and infinity on high. Then life seems almost enchanted after all.”
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: “Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor.”
Author: Truman Capote

Quote: “If I got rid of my demons, I’d lose my angels.”
Author: Tennessee Williams,

Quote: “She read books as one would breathe air, to fill up and live.”
Author: Annie Dillard,

Quote: “I realize only one person will be damaged beyond repair if Peeta dies. Me.”
Author: Suzanne Collins,

Quote: “Everyone is a moon, and has a dark side which he never shows to anybody.”
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: “If you are a dreamer come inIf you are a dreamer a wisher a liarA hoper a pray-er a magic-bean-buyerIf youre a pretender com sit by my fireFor we have some flax golden tales to spinCome in! Come in!”
Author: Shel Silverstein

Quote: “The real story of the Fleece: there were these two children of Zeus, Cadmus and Europa, okay? They were about to get offered up as human sacrifices, when they prayed to Zeus to save them. So Zeus sent this magical flying ram with golden wool, which picked them up in Greece and carried them all the ...
Author: Rick Riordan,

Quote: “In politics, If you want anything said, ask a man. If you want anything done, ask a woman.”
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: “Books should go where they will be most appreciated, and not sit unread, gathering dust on a forgotten shelf, don't you agree?”
Author: Christopher Paolini

Quote: “No woman really wants a man to carry her off; she only wants him to want to do it.”
Author: Elizabeth Peters

Quote: “You couldn't relive your life, skipping the awful parts, without losing what made it worthwhile. You had to accept it as a whole--like the world, or the person you loved.”
Author: Stewart O'Nan,

Quote: “I'm not young enough to know everything.”
Author: J.M. Barrie,

Quote: “When I am with you, we stay up all night.When you're not here, I can't go to sleep.Praise God for those two insomnias!And the difference between them.”
Author: Rumi

Quote: “Have no fear of perfection - you'll never reach it.”
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: “The snake which cannot cast its skin has to die. As well the minds which are prevented from changing their opinions; they cease to be mind.”
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: “I realize now that dying is easy. Living is hard.”
Author: Gayle Forman,

Quote: “When people don't express themselves, they die one piece at a time.”
Author: Laurie Halse Anderson,

Quote: “Tears shed for another person are not a sign of weakness. They are a sign of a pure heart.”
Author: José N. Harris,
Book: MI VIDA: A Story of Faith, Hope and Love

Quote: “I am trying here to prevent anyone saying the really foolish thing that people often say about Him: I’m ready to accept Jesus as a great moral teacher, but I don’t accept his claim to be God. That is the one thing we must not say. A man who was merely a man and said the sort of things Jesus said wo...
Author: C.S. Lewis,

Quote: “Most of all, I hate you because I think of you. Often. It's disgusting, and I can't stop.”
Author: Holly Black,

Quote: “I knew when I met you an adventure was going to happen.”
Author: A.A. Milne

Quote: “Everybody talks about wanting to change things and help and fix, but ultimately all you can do is fix yourself. And that's a lot. Because if you can fix yourself, it has a ripple effect.”
Author: Rob Reiner

Quote: “A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving.”
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: “Before you, Bella, my life was like a moonless night. Very dark, but there were stars, points of light and reason. ...And then you shot across my sky like a meteor. Suddenly everything was on fire; there was brilliancy, there was beauty. When you were gone, when the meteor had fallen over the horiz...
Author: Stephenie Meyer,

Quote: “A truth that's told with bad intentBeats all the lies you can invent.”
Author: William Blake,

Quote: “Some lose all mind and become soul,insane.some lose all soul and become mind, intellectual.some lose both and become accepted”
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: “There is only one thing in the world worse than being talked about, and that is not being talked about.”
Author: Oscar Wilde,

Quote: “I have absolutely no pleasure in the stimulants in which I sometimes so madly indulge. It has not been in the pursuit of pleasure that I have periled life and reputation and reason. It has been the desperate attempt to escape from torturing memories, from a sense of insupportable loneliness and a d...
Author: Edgar Allan Poe

Quote: “All your life, you will be faced with a choice. You can choose love or hate…I choose love.”
Author: Johnny Cash

Quote: “If you don't know, the thing to do is not to get scared, but to learn.”
Author: Ayn Rand,

Quote: “I've found that there is always some beauty left -- in nature, sunshine, freedom, in yourself; these can all help you.”
Author: Anne Frank,
Book: The Diary of a Young Girl

Quote: “A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools.”
Author: Douglas Adams,

Quote: “Any fool knows men and women think differently at times, but the biggest difference is this. Men forget, but never forgive; women forgive, but never forget.”
Author: Robert Jordan

Quote: “That's why they call it the American Dream, because you have to be asleep to believe it.”
Author: George Carlin

Quote: “Time is Too Slow for those who Wait, Too Swift for those who Fear, Too Long for those who Grieve, Too Short for those who Rejoice; But for those who Love, Time is not.”
Author: Henry van Dyke,

Quote: “Biology gives you a brain. Life turns it into a mind.”
Author: Jeffrey Eugenides,

Quote: “It's just that most really good-looking people are stupid, so I exceed expectations.''Right, it's primarily his hotness,' I said.'It can be sort of blinding,' he said.'It actually did blind our friend Isaac,' I said.'Terrible tragedy, that. But can I help my own deadly beauty?''You cannot.''It is m...
Author: John Green,

Quote: “America will never be destroyed from the outside. If we falter and lose our freedoms, it will be because we destroyed ourselves.”
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: “Every one of us is, in the cosmic perspective, precious. If a human disagrees with you, let him live. In a hundred billion galaxies, you will not find another.”
Author: Carl Sagan,

Quote: “Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars.”
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: “Stuff your eyes with wonder, he said, live as if you'd drop dead in ten seconds. See the world. It's more fantastic than any dream made or paid for in factories.”
Author: Ray Bradbury,

Quote: “Sometimes,' said Pooh, 'the smallest things take up the most room in your heart.”
Author: A.A. Milne

Quote: “In life, unlike chess, the game continues after checkmate.”
Author: Isaac Asimov

Quote: “A purpose of human life, no matter who is controlling it, is to love whoever is around to be loved.”
Author: Kurt Vonnegut,

Quote: “If you don't like someone's story, write your own.”
Author: Chinua Achebe

Quote: “I regret that it takes a life to learn how to live.”
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,

Quote: “Stay gold, Ponyboy. Stay gold . . .” The pillow seemed to sink a little, and Johnny died.”
Author: S.E. Hinton,

Quote: “Children must be taught how to think, not what to think.”
Author: Margaret Mead

Quote: “Why were you lurking under our window?Yes - yes, good point, Petunia! What were you doing under our windows, boy?Listening to the news, said Harry in a resigned voice.His aunt and uncle exchanged looks of outrage.Listening to the news! Again?Well, it changes every day, you see, said Harry.”
Author: J.K. Rowling,
Book: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

Quote: “Sometimes when I look at you, I feel I'm gazing at a distant star. It's dazzling, but the light is from tens of thousands of years ago.Maybe the star doesn't even exist any more. Yet sometimes that light seems more real to me than anything.”
Author: Haruki Murakami,
Book: South of the Border, West of the Sun

Quote: “I loved you like a man loves a woman he never touches, only writes to, keeps little photographs of.”
Author: Charles Bukowski,
Book: Love Is a Dog from Hell

Quote: “I came from a real tough neighborhood. Once a guy pulled a knife on me. I knew he wasn't a professional, the knife had butter on it.”
Author: Rodney Dangerfield

Quote: “I stood still, vision blurring, and in that moment, I heard my heart break. It was a small, clean sound, like the snapping of a flower's stem.”
Author: Diana Gabaldon,

Quote: “Is it so bad, then, to be misunderstood? Pythagoras was misunderstood, and Socrates, and Jesus, and Luther, and Copernicus, and Galileo, and Newton, and every pure and wise spirit that ever took flesh. To be great is to be misunderstood.”
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,

Quote: “All the secrets of the world are contained in books. Read at your own risk.”
Author: Lemony Snicket

Quote: “It's a lot easier to be lost than found. It's the reason we're always searching and rarely discovered--so many locks not enough keys.”
Author: Sarah Dessen,

Quote: “Letting go doesn't mean that you don't care about someone anymore. It's just realizing that the only person you really have control over is yourself.”
Author: Deborah Reber,
Book: Chicken Soup for the Teenage Soul: 101 Stories of Life, Love and Learning

Quote: “A DEFINITION NOT FOUNDIN THE DICTIONARYNot leaving: an act of trust and love,often deciphered by children”
Author: Markus Zusak,

Quote: “I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship.”
Author: Louisa May Alcott,

Quote: “I'm oxygen and he's dying to breathe.”
Author: Tahereh Mafi,

Quote: “Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.”
Author: Winston S. Churchill

Quote: “Was it hard? I ask.Letting go?Not as hard as holding on to something that wasn't real.”
Author: Lisa Schroeder

Quote: “A single dream is more powerful than a thousand realities.”
Author: Nathaniel Hawthorne,

Quote: “She says nothing at all, but simply stares upward into the dark sky and watches, with sad eyes, the slow dance of the infinite stars.”
Author: Neil Gaiman,

Quote: “One can never have enough socks, said Dumbledore. Another Christmas has come and gone and I didn't get a single pair. People will insist on giving me books.”
Author: J.K. Rowling,
Book: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

Quote: “I've got nothing to do today but smile.”
Author: Simon and Garfunkel

Quote: “There is no mistaking a real book when one meets it. It is like falling in love.”
Author: Christopher Morley,

Quote: “It's like Tolstoy said. Happiness is an allegory, unhappiness a story.”
Author: Haruki Murakami,

Quote: “She was the heir of ash and fire, and she would bow to no one.”
Author: Sarah J. Maas,

Quote: “Ah! There is nothing like staying at home, for real comfort.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “Some people say, “Never let them see you cry.” I say, if you’re so mad you could just cry, then cry. It terrifies everyone.”
Author: Tina Fey,

Quote: “The unreal is more powerful than the real. Because nothing is as perfect as you can imagine it. Because its only intangible ideas, concepts, beliefs, fantasies that last. Stone crumbles. Wood rots. People, well, they die. But things as fragile as a thought, a dream, a legend, they can go on and on....
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,

Quote: “It's often just enough to be with someone. I don't need to touch them. Not even talk. A feeling passes between you both. You're not alone.”
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: “A book is really like a lover. It arranges itself in your life in a way that is beautiful.”
Author: Maurice Sendak

Quote: “Clothes make the man. Naked people have little or no influence on society.”
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: “Books say: She did this because. Life says: She did this. Books are where things are explained to you; life is where things aren't. I'm not surprised some people prefer books.”
Author: Julian Barnes,

Quote: “We do not grow absolutely, chronologically. We grow sometimes in one dimension, and not in another; unevenly. We grow partially. We are relative. We are mature in one realm, childish in another. The past, present, and future mingle and pull us backward, forward, or fix us in the present. We are mad...
Author: Anais Nin

Quote: “I say let the world go to hell, but I should always have my tea.”
Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky,

Quote: “Anyway, I keep picturing all these little kids playing some game in this big field of rye and all. Thousands of little kids, and nobody's around - nobody big, I mean - except me. And I'm standing on the edge of some crazy cliff. What I have to do, I have to catch everybody if they start to go over ...
Author: J.D. Salinger

Quote: “Yes, I was infatuated with you: I am still. No one has ever heightened such a keen capacity of physical sensation in me. I cut you out because I couldn't stand being a passing fancy. Before I give my body, I must give my thoughts, my mind, my dreams. And you weren't having any of those.”
Author: Sylvia Plath,
Book: The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

Quote: “When everyone knows you’re a monster, you needn’t waste time doing every monstrous thing.”
Author: Leigh Bardugo,

Quote: “The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any.”
Author: Alice Walker

Quote: “If neurotic is wanting two mutually exclusive things at one and the same time, then I'm neurotic as hell. I'll be flying back and forth between one mutually exclusive thing and another for the rest of my days.”
Author: Sylvia Plath,

Quote: “But who can say what's best? That's why you need to grab whatever chance you have of happiness where you find it, and not worry about other people too much. My experience tells me that we get no more than two or three such chances in a life time, and if we let them go, we regret it for the rest of ...
Author: Haruki Murakami,

Quote: “A writer is someone for whom writing is more difficult than it is for other people.”
Author: Thomas Mann,

Quote: “I think there's just one kind of folks. Folks.”
Author: Harper Lee,

Quote: “I cannot make you understand. I cannot make anyone understand what is happening inside me. I cannot even explain it to myself.”
Author: Franz Kafka,

Quote: “Books are easily destroyed. But words will live as long as people can remember them.”
Author: Tahereh Mafi,

Quote: “Respect was invented to cover the empty place where love should be.”
Author: Leo Tolstoy,

Quote: “We are cups, constantly and quietly being filled. The trick is, knowing how to tip ourselves over and let the beautiful stuff out.”
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quote: “The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails.”
Author: William Arthur Ward

Quote: “The capacity for friendship is God's way of apologizing for our families.”
Author: Jay McInerney,

Quote: “I believe a strong woman may be stronger than a man, particularly if she happens to have love in her heart. I guess a loving woman is indestructible.”
Author: John Steinbeck,

Quote: “I cannot sleep unless I am surrounded by books.”
Author: Jorge Luis Borges

Quote: “Dogs never bite me. Just humans.”
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: “If you hate a person, you hate something in him that is part of yourself. What isn't part of ourselves doesn't disturb us.”
Author: Hermann Hesse,
Book: Demian: Die Geschichte von Emil Sinclairs Jugend

Quote: “There are so many fragile things, after all. People break so easily, and so do dreams and hearts.”
Author: Neil Gaiman,
Book: Fragile Things: Short Fictions and Wonders

Quote: “I'm tough, I'm ambitious, and I know exactly what I want. If that makes me a bitch, okay.”
Author: Madonna

Quote: “You endure what is unbearable, and you bear it. That is all.”
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quote: “أتمنى أن أبكي و أرتجف , التصق بواحد من الكبار , لكن الحقيقة القاسية هي أنك الكبار! .. أنت من يجب أن يمنح القوة و الأمن للآخرين!”
Author: أحمد خالد توفيق

Quote: “Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not yet come. We have only today. Let us begin.”
Author: Mother Theresa

Quote: “Would it save you a lot of time if I just gave up and went mad now?”
Author: Douglas Adams,
Book: The Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy

Quote: “The clearest way into the Universe is through a forest wilderness.”
Author: John Muir

Quote: “There are good days and hard days for me—even now. Don’t let the hard days win.”
Author: Sarah J. Maas,
Book: A Court of Mist and Fury

Quote: “If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and man.”
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: “You will find that it is necessary to let things go; simply for the reason that they are heavy. So let them go, let go of them. I tie no weights to my ankles.”
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: “Real loneliness is not necessarily limited to when you are alone.”
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: “Still round the corner there may wait A new road or a secret gateAnd though I oft have passed them by A day will come at last when IShall take the hidden paths that run West of the Moon, East of the Sun.”
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien

Quote: “Science and religion are not at odds. Science is simply too young to understand.”
Author: Dan Brown,

Quote: “It is my belief... that the truth is generally preferable to lies.”
Author: J.K. Rowling,
Book: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

Quote: “Don't Gain The World & Lose Your Soul, Wisdom Is Better Than Silver Or Gold.”
Author: Bob Marley

Quote: “Remember to always be yourself. Unless you suck.”
Author: Joss Whedon

Quote: “I am selfish. I am brave.”
Author: Veronica Roth,

Quote: “You can't depend on your eyes when your imagination is out of focus.”
Author: Mark Twain,
Book: A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court

Quote: “Maybe everyone can live beyond what they're capable of.”
Author: Markus Zusak,

Quote: “But in a solitary life, there are rare moments when another soul dips near yours, as stars once a year brush the earth. Such a constellation was he to me.”
Author: Madeline Miller,

Quote: “I am looking for friends. What does that mean -- tame?It is an act too often neglected, said the fox. It means to establish ties. To establish ties? Just that, said the fox. To me, you are still nothing more than a little boy who is just like a hundred thousand other little boys. And I have no need...
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,

Quote: “It was, he thought, the difference between being dragged into the arena to face a battle to the death and walking into the arena with your head held high. Some people, perhaps, would say that there was little to choose between the two ways, but Dumbledore knew - and so do I, thought Harry, with a r...
Author: J.K. Rowling,
Book: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

Quote: “Sometimes when I'm talking, my words can't keep up with my thoughts. I wonder why we think faster than we speak. Probably so we can think twice.”
Author: Bill Watterson

Quote: “I desire the things which will destroy me in the end.”
Author: Sylvia Plath,
Book: The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

Quote: “You only get one life. It's actually your duty to live it as fully as possible.”
Author: Jojo Moyes,

Quote: “It's amazing how a little tomorrow can make up for a whole lot of yesterday.”
Author: John Guare,

Quote: “Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.”
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quote: “Kindred spirits are not so scarce as I used to think. It's splendid to find out there are so many of them in the world.”
Author: L.M. Montgomery,

Quote: “Much of my life had been devoted to trying not to cry in front of people who loved me, so I knew what Augustus was doing. You clench your teeth. You look up. You tell yourself that if they see you cry, it will hurt them, and you will be nothing but a Sadness in their lives, and you must not become ...
Author: John Green,

Quote: “Better to be strong than pretty and useless.”
Author: Lilith Saintcrow,

Quote: “From the moment I picked up your book until I put it down, I was convulsed with laughter. Some day I intend reading it.”
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: “There is a sacredness in tears....They are the messengers of overwhelming grief, of deep contrition and of unspeakable love.”
Author: Washington Irving

Quote: “Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens”
Author: Jimi Hendrix

Quote: “let me live, love, and say it well in good sentences”
Author: Sylvia Plath,
Book: The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

Quote: “People can lose their lives in libraries. They ought to be warned.”
Author: Saul Bellow

Quote: “The one thing we can never get enough of is love. And the one thing we never give enough of is love.”
Author: Henry Miller

Quote: “A learning experience is one of those things that says, 'You know that thing you just did? Don't do that.”
Author: Douglas Adams,
Book: The Salmon of Doubt: Hitchhiking the Galaxy One Last Time

Quote: “I like good strong words that mean something…”
Author: Louisa May Alcott,

Quote: “I meant, said Ipslore bitterly, what is there in this world that truly makes living worthwhile?Death thought about it.CATS, he said eventually. CATS ARE NICE.”
Author: Terry Pratchett,

Quote: “I'm not going to wear a red dress, she said.It would look stunning, My Lady, she called.She spoke to the bubbles gathered on the surface of the water. If there's anyone I wish to stun at dinner, I'll hit him in the face.”
Author: Kristin Cashore,

Quote: “being alone never felt right. sometimes it felt good, but it never felt right.”
Author: Charles Bukowski,

Quote: “And he took her in his arms and kissed her under the sunlit sky, and he cared not that they stood high upon the walls in the sight of many.”
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien

Quote: “This is what you shall do; Love the earth and sun and the animals, despise riches, give alms to every one that asks, stand up for the stupid and crazy, devote your income and labor to others, hate tyrants, argue not concerning God, have patience and indulgence toward the people, take off your hat t...
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: “The only way that we can live, is if we grow. The only way that we can grow is if we change. The only way that we can change is if we learn. The only way we can learn is if we are exposed. And the only way that we can become exposed is if we throw ourselves out into the open. Do it. Throw yourself....
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: “Love the life you live.Live the life you love.”
Author: Bob Marley

Quote: “Wisdom comes from experience. Experience is often a result of lack of wisdom.”
Author: Terry Pratchett

Quote: “You realize that our mistrust of the future makes it hard to give up the past.”
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,

Quote: “We both have war inside us. Sometimes it keeps us alive. Sometimes it threatens to destroy us.”
Author: Veronica Roth,

Quote: “Let's think the unthinkable, let's do the undoable. Let us prepare to grapple with the ineffable itself, and see if we may not eff it after all.”
Author: Douglas Adams,

Quote: “There is no such thing as bad people. We’re all just people who sometimes do bad things.”
Author: Colleen Hoover,

Quote: “Great minds are always feared by lesser minds.”
Author: Dan Brown,

Quote: “Our story has three parts: a beginning, a middle, and an end. And although this is the way all stories unfold, I still can't believe that ours didn't go on forever.”
Author: Nicholas Sparks,

Quote: “Make your own Bible. Select and collect all the words and sentences that in all your readings have been to you like the blast of a trumpet.”
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: “It's discouraging to think how many people are shocked by honesty and how few by deceit.”
Author: Noël Coward,

Quote: “I've been homesick for countries I've never been, and longed to be where I couldn't be.”
Author: John Cheever

Quote: “Even if you are on the right track, you’ll get run over if you just sit there.”
Author: Will Rogers

Quote: “Isn't it enough to see that a garden is beautiful without having to believe that there are fairies at the bottom of it too?”
Author: Douglas Adams,
Book: The Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy

Quote: “She seems so cool, so focused, so quiet, yet her eyes remain fixed upon the horizon. You think you know all there is to know about her immediately upon meeting her, but everything you think you know is wrong. Passion flows through her like a river of blood. She only looked away for a moment, and th...
Author: Neil Gaiman,
Book: Fragile Things: Short Fictions and Wonders

Quote: “You gave me a forever within the numbered days, and I'm grateful.”
Author: John Green,

Quote: “I have come to accept the feeling of not knowing where I am going. And I have trained myself to love it. Because it is only when we are suspended in mid-air with no landing in sight, that we force our wings to unravel and alas begin our flight. And as we fly, we still may not know where we are goin...
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: “Three may keep a secret, if two of them are dead.”
Author: Benjamin Franklin,

Quote: “Beauty is only skin deep, but ugly goes clean to the bone.”
Author: Dorothy Parker

Quote: “Of all the trees we could've hit, we had to get one that hits back.”
Author: J.K. Rowling,
Book: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Quote: “Anyone who falls in love is searching for the missing pieces of themselves. So anyone who's in love gets sad when they think of their lover. It's like stepping back inside a room you have fond memories of, one you haven't seen in a long time.”
Author: Murakami, Haruki

Quote: “The moon is a loyal companion.It never leaves. It’s always there, watching, steadfast, knowing us in our light and dark moments, changing forever just as we do. Every day it’s a different version of itself. Sometimes weak and wan, sometimes strong and full of light. The moon understands what it mea...
Author: Tahereh Mafi,

Quote: “If I had a world of my own, everything would be nonsense. Nothing would be what it is, because everything would be what it isn't. And contrary wise, what is, it wouldn't be. And what it wouldn't be, it would. You see?”
Author: Lewis Carroll,
Book: Alice’s Adventures in Wonderland / Through the Looking-Glass

Quote: “When you spend so long trapped in darkness, Lucien, you find that the darkness begins to stare back.”
Author: Sarah J. Maas,
Book: A Court of Mist and Fury

Quote: “Believe nothing you hear, and only one half that you see.”
Author: Edgar Allan Poe

Quote: “Even strength must bow to wisdom sometimes.”
Author: Rick Riordan,

Quote: “Fools talk, cowards are silent, wise men listen.”
Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon,

Quote: “Maybe there is a beast… maybe it's only us.”
Author: William Golding,

Quote: “Winter is coming.”
Author: George R.R. Martin,

Quote: “The best portion of a good man's life: his little, nameless unremembered acts of kindness and love.”
Author: William Wordsworth,

Quote: “Children begin by loving their parents; as they grow older they judge them; sometimes they forgive them.”
Author: Oscar Wilde,

Quote: “Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.”
Author: T.S. Eliot

Quote: “Happiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.”
Author: J.K. Rowling,
Book: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban

Quote: “The world is full of magic things, patiently waiting for our senses to grow sharper.”
Author: W.B. Yeats

Quote: “Cruelty does not make a person dishonest, the same way bravery does not make a person kind.”
Author: Veronica Roth,

Quote: “It is easier to forgive an enemy than to forgive a friend.”
Author: William Blake

Quote: “If you don't read the newspaper, you're uninformed. If you read the newspaper, you're mis-informed.”
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: “We can know only that we know nothing. And that is the highest degree of human wisdom.”
Author: Leo Tolstoy,

Quote: “Art and love are the same thing: It’s the process of seeing yourself in things that are not you.”
Author: Chuck Klosterman,
Book: Killing Yourself to Live: 85% of a True Story

Quote: “Lighthouses don’t go running all over an island looking for boats to save; they just stand there shining.”
Author: Anne Lamott

Quote: “Music expresses that which cannot be said and on which it is impossible to be silent.”
Author: Victor Hugo,

Quote: “To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance.”
Author: Oscar Wilde,

Quote: “Sometimes it's a form of love just to talk to somebody that you have nothing in common with and still be fascinated by their presence.”
Author: David Byrne

Quote: “And I asked myself about the present: how wide it was, how deep it was, how much was mine to keep.”
Author: Kurt Vonnegut,

Quote: “My Best Friend is a person who will give me a book I have not read.”
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: “People who deny the existence of dragons are often eaten by dragons. From within.”
Author: Ursula K. Le Guin,
Book: The Wave in the Mind: Talks and Essays on the Writer, the Reader and the Imagination

Quote: “A woman without a man is like a fish without a bicycle.”
Author: Irina Dunn

Quote: “It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.”
Author: Confucius

Quote: “I was wise enough never to grow up, while fooling people into believing I had.”
Author: Margaret Mead

Quote: “People have forgotten this truth, the fox said. But you mustn’t forget it. You become responsible forever for what you’ve tamed. You’re responsible for your rose.”
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,

Quote: “I am glad you are here with me. Here at the end of all things, Sam.”
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,

Quote: “There are books of which the backs and covers are by far the best parts.”
Author: Charles Dickens,

Quote: “Peeta, you said at the interview you’d had a crush on me forever. When did forever start?Oh, let’s see. I guess the first day of school. We were five. You had on a red plaid dress and your hair...it was in two braids instead of one. My father pointed you out when we were waiting to line up.Your fat...
Author: Suzanne Collins,

Quote: “If you want to keep a secret, you must also hide it from yourself.”
Author: George Orwell,

Quote: “Every now and then I like to do as I'm told, just to confuse people.”
Author: Tamora Pierce,

Quote: “A good book is an event in my life.”
Author: Stendhal,

Quote: “Never underestimate the power of stupid people in large groups.”
Author: George Carlin

Quote: “Don't be so humble - you are not that great.”
Author: Golda Meir

Quote: “There ain't no sin and there ain't no virtue. There's just stuff people do.”
Author: John Steinbeck,

Quote: “What you do makes a difference, and you have to decide what kind of difference you want to make.”
Author: Jane Goodall

Quote: “Don't tell me, Jace said, Simon's turned himself into an ocelot and you want me to do something about it before Isabelle makes him into a stole. Well, you'll have have to wait till tomorrow. I'm out of commission. He pointed at himself - he was wearing blue pajamas with a hole in the sleeve. Look. ...
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quote: “Only the dead have seen the end of war.”
Author: Plato

Quote: “I am constantly torn between killing myself and killing everyone around me.”
Author: David Levithan,

Quote: “Trying to define yourself is like trying to bite your own teeth.”
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: “Pain insists upon being attended to. God whispers to us in our pleasures, speaks in our consciences, but shouts in our pains. It is his megaphone to rouse a deaf world.”
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: “Everyone must leave something behind when he dies, my grandfather said. A child or a book or a painting or a house or a wall built or a pair of shoes made. Or a garden planted. Something your hand touched some way so your soul has somewhere to go when you die, and when people look at that tree or t...
Author: Ray Bradbury,

Quote: “It's possible to go on, no matter how impossible it seems, and that in time, the grief . . . lessens. It may not go away completely, but after a while it's not so overwhelming.”
Author: Nicholas Sparks,

Quote: “Yes, frosting. The final defense of the dying.”
Author: Suzanne Collins,

Quote: “May the forces of evil become confused on the way to your house.”
Author: George Carlin

Quote: “The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.”
Author: Bette Midler

Quote: “Light thinks it travels faster than anything but it is wrong. No matter how fast light travels, it finds the darkness has always got there first, and is waiting for it.”
Author: Terry Pratchett,

Quote: “He was going to live forever, or die in the attempt.”
Author: Joseph Heller,

Quote: “It is thanks to my evening reading alone that I am still more or less sane.”
Author: W.G. Sebald,

Quote: “I knew the second I met youthat there was something about you I needed. Turns out it wasn’t something about you at all. It was just you.”
Author: Jamie McGuire,

Quote: “I'm not sentimental--I'm as romantic as you are. The idea, you know,is that the sentimental person thinks things will last--the romanticperson has a desperate confidence that they won't.”
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,

Quote: “If I loved you less, I might be able to talk about it more.”
Author: Jane Austen,

Quote: “!لك شيء في هذا العالم.. فقم”
Author: غسان كنفاني

Quote: “In the beginning there was nothing, which exploded.”
Author: Terry Pratchett,

Quote: “I had already found that it was not good to be alone, and so made companionship with what there was around me, sometimes with the universe and sometimes with my own insignificant self; but my books were always my friends, let fail all else.”
Author: Joshua Slocum,

Quote: “My imagination functions much better when I don't have to speak to people.”
Author: Patricia Highsmith

Quote: “The world is a dangerous place to live, not because of the people who are evil, but because of the people who don't do anything about it.”
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: “My tongue will tell the anger of my heart, or else my heart concealing it will break.”
Author: William Shakespeare,

Quote: “It is absurd to divide people into good and bad. People are either charming or tedious.”
Author: Oscar Wilde,

Quote: “Who in the world am I? Ah, that's the great puzzle.”
Author: Lewis Carroll ,

Quote: “Today was good. Today was fun. Tomorrow is another one.”
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: “Creativity is intelligence having fun.”
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: “Never give up... No one knows what's going to happen next.”
Author: L. Frank Baum

Quote: “People shouldn't be afraid of their government. Governments should be afraid of their people.”
Author: Alan Moore,

Quote: “Once you had put the pieces back together, even though you may look intact, you were never quite the same as you'd been before the fall.”
Author: Jodi Picoult

Quote: “I wish I were a girl again, half-savage and hardy, and free.”
Author: Emily Brontë,

Quote: “Your beliefs become your thoughts, Your thoughts become your words, Your words become your actions, Your actions become your habits, Your habits become your values, Your values become your destiny.”
Author: Gandhi

Quote: “People worry about kids playing with guns, and teenagers watching violent videos; we are scared that some sort of culture of violence will take them over. Nobody worries about kids listening to thousands - literally thousands - of songs about broken hearts and rejection and pain and misery and loss...
Author: Nick Hornby,

Quote: “My soul is from elsewhere, I'm sure of that, and I intend to end up there.”
Author: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

Quote: “Remember, remember, this is now, and now, and now. Live it, feel it, cling to it. I want to become acutely aware of all I’ve taken for granted.”
Author: Sylvia Plath

Quote: “One day you will kiss a man you can't breathe without, and find that breath is of little consequence.”
Author: Karen Marie Moning,

Quote: “If I'd observed all the rules I'd never have got anywhere.”
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: “A dream you dream alone is only a dream. A dream you dream together is reality.”
Author: John Lennon

Quote: “I may not have been sure about what really did interest me, but I was absolutely sure about what didn't.”
Author: Albert Camus,

Quote: “She leaned down and looked at his lifeless face and Leisel kissed her best friend, Rudy Steiner, soft and true on his lips. He tasted dusty and sweet. He tasted like regret in the shadows of trees and in the glow of the anarchist's suit collection. She kissed him long and soft, and when she pulled ...
Author: Markus Zusak,

Quote: “Promise me you'll never forget me because if I thought you would, I'd never leave.”
Author: A.A. Milne

Quote: “DON'T THINK OF IT AS DYING, said Death. JUST THINK OF IT AS LEAVING EARLY TO AVOID THE RUSH.”
Author: Terry Pratchett,
Book: Good Omens: The Nice and Accurate Prophecies of Agnes Nutter, Witch

Quote: “Tess, Tess, Tessa. Was there ever a more beautiful sound than your name? To speak it aloud makes my heart ring like a bell. Strange to imagine that, isn’t it – a heart ringing – but when you touch me that is what it is like: as if my heart is ringing in my chest and the sound shivers down my veins ...
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quote: “No matter what he does, every person on earth plays a central role in the history of the world. And normally he doesn't know it.”
Author: Paulo Coelho,

Quote: “If things start happening, don't worry, don't stew, just go right along and you'll start happening too.”
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: “Those who know do not speak. Those who speak do not know.”
Author: Lao Tsu,

Quote: “Do not go gentle into that good night.Rage, rage against the dying of the light.”
Author: Dylan Thomas,
Book: In Country Sleep, and Other Poems

Quote: “For what it’s worth: it’s never too late or, in my case, too early to be whoever you want to be. There’s no time limit, stop whenever you want. You can change or stay the same, there are no rules to this thing. We can make the best or the worst of it. I hope you make the best of it. And I hope you ...
Author: Eric Roth,
Book: The Curious Case of Benjamin Button Screenplay

Quote: “The ships hung in the sky in much the same way that bricks don't.”
Author: Douglas Adams,
Book: The Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy

Quote: “Do not fall in love with people like me. I will take you to museums, and parks, and monuments, and kiss you in every beautiful place, so that you can never go back to them without tasting me like blood in your mouth.I will destroy you in the most beautiful way possible. And when I leave you will fi...
Author: Caitlyn Siehl,
Book: Literary Sexts: A Collection of Short & Sexy Love Poems

Quote: “Compassion is the basis of morality.”
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: “You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.”
Author: Sharon Salzberg

Quote: “I have learned now that while those who speak about one's miseries usually hurt, those who keep silence hurt more.”
Author: C. S. Lewis

Quote: “He was my mum and dad's best friend. He's a convicted murderer, but he's broken out of wizard prison and he's on the run. He likes to keep in touch with me, though...keep up with my news...check if I'm happy...”
Author: J.K. Rowling,
Book: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban

Quote: “When the heart speaks, the mind finds it indecent to object.”
Author: Milan Kundera,

Quote: “I wonder if the snow loves the trees and fields, that it kisses them so gently? And then it covers them up snug, you know, with a white quilt; and perhaps it says, Go to sleep, darlings, till the summer comes again.”
Author: Lewis Carroll,
Book: Alice’s Adventures in Wonderland / Through the Looking-Glass

Quote: “My library is an archive of longings.”
Author: Susan Sontag,
Book: As Consciousness is Harnessed to Flesh: Journals and Notebooks, 1964-1980

Quote: “Did you know that for pretty much the entire history of the human species, the average life span was less than thirty years? You could count on ten years or so of real adulthood, right? There was no planning for retirement, There was no planning for a career. There was no planning. No time for plan...
Author: John Green,

Quote: “But he who dares not grasp the thorn Should never crave the rose.”
Author: Anne Bronte

Quote: “Male fantasies, male fantasies, is everything run by male fantasies? Up on a pedestal or down on your knees, it's all a male fantasy: that you're strong enough to take what they dish out, or else too weak to do anything about it. Even pretending you aren't catering to male fantasies is a male fanta...
Author: Margaret Atwood,

Quote: “My bounty is as boundless as the sea,My love as deep; the more I give to thee,The more I have, for both are infinite.”
Author: William Shakespeare,

Quote: “What are all these? Clary asked.Vials of holy water, blessed knives, steel and silver blades, Jace said, piling the weapons on the floor beside him, electrum wire - not much use at the moment but it's always good to have spares - silver bullets, charms of protetion, crucifixes, stars of David-Jesus...
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quote: “silence is the language of god, all else is poor translation.”
Author: Rumi

Quote: “Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake.”
Author: Napoleon Bonaparte

Quote: “Though my soul may set in darkness, it will rise in perfect light; I have loved the stars too fondly to be fearful of the night.”
Author: Sarah   Williams,
Book: Twilight Hours: A Legacy of Verse

Quote: “For whatever we lose (like a you or a me),It's always our self we find in the sea.”
Author: e.e. cummings,

Quote: “Tell me and I forget, teach me and I may remember, involve me and I learn.”
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quote: “Sonnet XVIII do not love you as if you were salt-rose, or topaz,or the arrow of carnations the fire shoots off.I love you as certain dark things are to be loved,in secret, between the shadow and the soul.I love you as the plant that never bloomsbut carries in itself the light of hidden flowers;than...
Author: Pablo Neruda

Quote: “I must learn to be content with being happier than I deserve.”
Author: Jane Austen,

Quote: “One thing you can't hide - is when you're crippled inside.”
Author: John Lennon

Quote: “In individuals, insanity is rare; but in groups, parties, nations and epochs, it is the rule.”
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: “No one knows for certain how much impact they have on the lives of other people. Oftentimes, we have no clue. Yet we push it just the same.”
Author: Jay Asher,

Quote: “In a way, it's nice to know that there are Greek gods out there, because you have somebody to blame when things go wrong. For instance, when you're walking away from a bus that's just been attacked by monster hags and blown up by lightning, and it's raining on top of everything else, most people mi...
Author: Rick Riordan,

Quote: “There was another life that I might have had, but I am having this one.”
Author: Kazuo Ishiguro

Quote: “It's the questions we can't answer that teach us the most. They teach us how to think. If you give a man an answer, all he gains is a little fact. But give him a question and he'll look for his own answers.”
Author: Patrick Rothfuss,

Quote: “Most books on witchcraft will tell you that witches work naked. This is because most books on witchcraft were written by men.”
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: “I want to see you.Know your voice.Recognize you when youfirst come 'round the corner.Sense your scent when I come into a room you've just left.Know the lift of your heel,the glide of your foot.Become familiar with the way you purse your lipsthen let them part, just the slightest bit,when I lean in ...
Author: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

Quote: “The best fantasy is written in the language of dreams. It is alive as dreams are alive, more real than real ... for a moment at least ... that long magic moment before we wake. Fantasy is silver and scarlet, indigo and azure, obsidian veined with gold and lapis lazuli. Reality is plywood and plasti...
Author: George R.R. Martin

Quote: “Don't wait for a light to appear at the end of the tunnel, stride down there and light the bloody thing yourself.”
Author: Sara Henderson

Quote: “Is there no way out of the mind?”
Author: Sylvia Plath

Quote: “Always do what is right. It will gratify half of mankind and astound the other.”
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: “Love is the absence of judgment.”
Author: Dalai Lama XIV

Quote: “You're alive only once, as far as we know, and what could be worse than getting to the end of your life and realizing you hadn't lived it?”
Author: Edward Albee

Quote: “I didn’t need you, you idiot. I picked you. And then you picked me back.”
Author: John Green,

Quote: “There is only one sin. and that is theft... when you tell a lie, you steal someones right to the truth.”
Author: Khaled Hosseini,

Quote: “We can never judge the lives of others, because each person knows only their own pain and renunciation. It's one thing to feel that you are on the right path, but it's another to think that yours is the only path.”
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: “I knew, in the silence that followed, that anything could happen here. It might be too late: again, I might have missed my chance. But I would at least know I tried, that I took my heart and extended my hand, whatever the outcome.Okay, he said. He took a breath. What would you do, if you could do a...
Author: Sarah Dessen,

Quote: “You possess other people's...bodies.He accepted that statement with a nod.Do you want to possess my body?I want to do a lot of things to your body, but that's not one of them.”
Author: Becca Fitzpatrick,

Quote: “Our memory is a more perfect world than the universe: it gives back life to those who no longer exist.”
Author: Guy de Maupassant

Quote: “Confidence is ignorance. If you're feeling cocky, it's because there's something you don't know.”
Author: Eoin Colfer,

Quote: “Keep smiling, because life is a beautiful thing and there's so much to smile about.”
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: “There is greatness in doing something you hate for the sake of someone you love.”
Author: Shmuley Boteach

Quote: “When I had nothing to lose, I had everything. When I stopped being who I am, I found myself.”
Author: Paulo Coelho,

Quote: “Success makes so many people hate you. I wish it wasn't that way. It would be wonderful to enjoy success without seeing envy in the eyes of those around you.”
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: “The beauty of a woman is not in the clothes she wears, the figure that she carries, or the way she combs her hair. The beauty of a woman is seen in her eyes, because that is the doorway to her heart, the place where love resides. True beauty in a woman is reflected in her soul. It's the caring that...
Author: Audrey Hepburn

Quote: “Art enables us to find ourselves and lose ourselves at the same time.”
Author: Thomas Merton ,

Quote: “Youth can not know how age thinks and feels. But old men are guilty if they forget what it was to be young.”
Author: J.K. Rowling ,
Book: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

Quote: “The library is inhabited by spirits that come out of the pages at night.”
Author: Isabel Allende

Quote: “They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety.”
Author: Benjamin Franklin,
Book: Memoirs of the life & writings of Benjamin Franklin

Quote: “You have to know what you stand for, not just what you stand against.”
Author: Laurie Halse Anderson,

Quote: “I do not think, sir, you have any right to command me, merely because you are older than I, or because you have seen more of the world than I have; your claim to superiority depends on the use you have made of your time and experience.”
Author: Charlotte Brontë,

Quote: “There are some things you can't share without ending up liking each other, and knocking out a twelve-foot mountain troll is one of them.”
Author: J. K. Rowling,
Book: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

Quote: “You can have it all. Just not all at once.”
Author: Oprah Winfrey

Quote: “Lolita, light of my life, fire of my loins. My sin, my soul. Lo-lee-ta: the tip of the tongue taking a trip of three steps down the palate to tap, at three, on the teeth. Lo. Lee. Ta. She was Lo, plain Lo, in the morning, standing four feet ten in one sock. She was Lola in slacks. She was Dolly at ...
Author: Vladimir Nabokov,

Quote: “We didn't talk about anything heavy or light. We were just there together. And that was enough”
Author: Stephen Chbosky,
Book: The Perks of Being a Wallflower

Quote: “Nobody tells this to people who are beginners, I wish someone told me. All of us who do creative work, we get into it because we have good taste. But there is this gap. For the first couple years you make stuff, it’s just not that good. It’s trying to be good, it has potential, but it’s not. But yo...
Author: Ira Glass

Quote: “I will remember the kisses our lips raw with love and how you gave me everything you had and how I offered you what was left of me, and I will remember your small room the feel of you the light in the window your records your books our morning coffee our noons our nights our bodies spilled together...
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: “Owners of dogs will have noticed that, if you provide them with food and water and shelter and affection, they will think you are god. Whereas owners of cats are compelled to realize that, if you provide them with food and water and shelter and affection, they draw the conclusion that they are gods...
Author: Christopher Hitchens,
Book: The Portable Atheist: Essential Readings for the Nonbeliever

Quote: “Then I realize what it is. It's him. Something about him makes me feel like I am about to fall. Or turn to liquid. Or burst into flames.”
Author: Veronica Roth,

Quote: “Silence make the real conversations between friends. Not the saying, but the never needing to say that counts.”
Author: Margaret Lee Runbeck

Quote: “Have a heart that never hardens, and a temper that never tires, and a touch that never hurts.”
Author: Charles Dickens

Quote: “You think my first instinct is to protect you. Because you're small, or a girl, or a Stiff. But you're wrong.He leans his face close to mine and wraps his fingers around my chin. His hand smells like metal. When was the last time he held a gun, or a knife? My skin tingles at the point of contact, l...
Author: Veronica Roth,

Quote: “So when the moon's only partly full, you only feel a little wolfy? You could say that.Well, you can go ahead and hang your head out the car window if you feel like it.I'm a werewolf, not a golden retriever.”
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: “Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear - not absence of fear.”
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: “I wanted a perfect ending. Now I've learned, the hard way, that some poems don't rhyme, and some stories don't have a clear beginning, middle, and end.”
Author: Gilda Radner

Quote: “Lost opportunities, lost possibilities, feelings we can never get back. That's part of what it means to be alive. But inside our heads - at least that's where I imagine it - there's a little room where we store those memories. A room like the stacks in this library. And to understand the workings o...
Author: Haruki Murakami,

Quote: “Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.”
Author: Confucious

Quote: “A child can teach an adult three things: to be happy for no reason, to always be busy with something, and to know how to demand with all his might that which he desires.”
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: “Life isn't finding shelter in the storm. It's about learning to dance in the rain.”
Author: Sherrilyn Kenyon,

Quote: “Books, she has found, are a way to live a thousand lives--or to find strength in a very long one.”
Author: V.E. Schwab,
Book: The Invisible Life of Addie LaRue

Quote: “A girl should be two things: who and what she wants.”
Author: Coco Chanel,
Book: Gospel According to Coco Chanel: Life Lessons From The World's Most Elegant Woman

Quote: “The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.”
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: “Go on with what your heart tells you, or you will lose all.”
Author: Rick Riordan,

Quote: “I bet you could sometimes find all the mysteries of the universe in someone's hand.”
Author: Benjamin Alire Sáenz,
Book: Aristotle and Dante Discover the Secrets of the Universe

Quote: “In a time of destruction, create something.”
Author: Maxine Hong Kingston

Quote: “Quotation is a serviceable substitute for wit.”
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: “A book lying idle on a shelf is wasted ammunition.”
Author: Henry Miller,

Quote: “How nice -- to feel nothing, and still get full credit for being alive.”
Author: Kurt Vonnegut,

Quote: “We need, in love, to practice only this: letting each other go. For holding on comes easily; we do not need to learn it.”
Author: Rainer Maria Rilke,
Book: Translations from the Poetry of Rainer Maria Rilke

Quote: “و كلما أمسكت بحالة من حالاتي و قلت هذا هو أنا .. ما تلبث هذه الحالة أن تفلت من أصابعي و تحل محلها حالة أخرى .. هي أنا .. أيضاً..”
Author: مصطفى محمود,

Quote: “I'm saying that I'm a moody, insecure, narrow-minded, jealous, borderline homicidal bitch, and I want you to promise me that you're okay with that, because it's who I am, and you're what I need.”
Author: Jeaniene Frost,

Quote: “Nothing in the world is ever completely wrong. Even a stopped clock is right twice a day.”
Author: Paulo Coelho,

Quote: “But how could you live and have no story to tell?”
Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky,

Quote: “Never forget what you are, for surely the world will not. Make it your strength. Then it can never be your weakness.”
Author: George R.R. Martin,
Book: A Song of Ice and Fire, 5-Book Boxed Set: A Game of Thrones, A Clash of Kings, A Storm of Swords, A Feast for Crows, A Dance with Dragons

Quote: “I suppose a fire that burns that bright is not meant to last.”
Author: Veronica Roth,

Quote: “My name is Celaena Sardothien. But it makes no difference if my name's Celaena or Lillian or Bitch, because I'd still beat you, no matter what you call me.”
Author: Sarah J. Maas,

Quote: “That which can be asserted without evidence, can be dismissed without evidence.”
Author: Christopher Hitchens

Quote: “Just because you're paranoid doesn't mean they aren't after you.”
Author: Joseph Heller,

Quote: “Every time you smile at someone, it is an action of love, a gift to that person, a beautiful thing.”
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: “Keep in mind that people change, but the past doesn't.”
Author: Becca Fitzpatrick,

Quote: “If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to.”
Author: Dorothy Parker

Quote: “A half-read book is a half-finished love affair.”
Author: David Mitchell,

Quote: “Lack of direction, not lack of time, is the problem. We all have twenty-four hour days.”
Author: Zig Ziglar

Quote: “The glory of friendship is not the outstretched hand, not the kindly smile, nor the joy of companionship; it is the spiritual inspiration that comes to one when you discover that someone else believes in you and is willing to trust you with a friendship.”
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: “A lot of you cared, just not enough.”
Author: Jay Asher,

Quote: “Tact is the ability to tell someone to go to hell in such a way that they look forward to the trip.”
Author: Winston Churchill

Quote: “Older men declare war. But it is youth that must fight and die.”
Author: Herbert Hoover

Quote: “Books are the carriers of civilization...They are companions, teachers, magicians, bankers of the treasures of the mind. Books are humanity in print.”
Author: Barbara W. Tuchman

Quote: “A snowball in the face is surely the perfect beginning to a lasting friendship.”
Author: Markus Zusak,

Quote: “Your friend's poetry is terrible, he said.Clary blinked, caught momentarily off guard. What?I said his poetry was terrible. It sounds like he ate a dictionary and started vomiting up words at random.”
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quote: “أحسد الأطفال الرضّع، لأنهم يملكون وحدهم حق الصراخ والقدرة عليه، قبل أن تروض الحياة حبالهم الصوتية، وتعلِّمهم الصمت”
Author: أحلام مستغانمي,

Quote: “If you end up with a boring miserable life because you listened to your mom, your dad, your teacher, your priest, or some guy on television telling you how to do your shit, then you deserve it.”
Author: Frank Zappa

Quote: “What's the good of living if you don't try a few things?”
Author: Charles M. Schulz

Quote: “Dreams like a podcast,Downloading truth in my ears.They tell me cool stuff.Apollo? I guess, because I figured nobody else could make a haiku that bad.He put his finger to his lips. I'm incognito. Call me Fred.A god named Fred?”
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: “You should never be surprised when someone treats you with respect, you should expect it.”
Author: Sarah Dessen,

Quote: “Change will not come if we wait for some other person, or if we wait for some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek.”
Author: Barack Obama

Quote: “I am free and that is why I am lost.”
Author: Franz Kafka

Quote: “Man only likes to count his troubles; he doesn't calculate his happiness.”
Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky,
Book: Notes from Underground, White Nights, The Dream of a Ridiculous Man, and Selections from The House of the Dead

Quote: “We're staying together, he promised. You're not getting away from me. Never again.”
Author: Rick Riordan,

Quote: “Don't spend time beating on a wall, hoping to transform it into a door. ”
Author: Coco Chanel

Quote: “Every book, every volume you see here, has a soul. The soul of the person who wrote it and of those who read it and lived and dreamed with it. Every time a book changes hands, every time someone runs his eyes down its pages, its spirit grows and strengthens.”
Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,

Quote: “Dreams do come true, if only we wish hard enough. You can have anything in life if you will sacrifice everything else for it.”
Author: J.M. Barrie,

Quote: “When I get lonely these days, I think: So BE lonely, Liz. Learn your way around loneliness. Make a map of it. Sit with it, for once in your life. Welcome to the human experience. But never again use another person's body or emotions as a scratching post for your own unfulfilled yearnings.”
Author: Elizabeth Gilbert,

Quote: “Kindness is a language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.”
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: “Expose yourself to your deepest fear; after that, fear has no power, and the fear of freedom shrinks and vanishes. You are free.”
Author: Jim Morrison

Quote: “Time doesn’t heal emotional pain, you need to learn how to let go.”
Author: Roy T. Bennett,

Quote: “When you find your path, you must not be afraid. You need to have sufficient courage to make mistakes. Disappointment, defeat, and despair are the tools God uses to show us the way.”
Author: Paulo Coelho,

Quote: “Atheism turns out to be too simple. If the whole universe has no meaning, we should never have found out that it has no meaning...”
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: “Must you go? I was rather hoping you'd stay and be a ministering angel, but if you must go, you must.I'll stay, Will said a bit crossly, and threw himself down in the armchair Tessa had just vacated. I can minister angelically.None too convincingly. And you're not as pretty to look at as Tessa is, ...
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quote: “All parents damage their children. It cannot be helped. Youth, like pristine glass, absorbs the prints of its handlers. Some parents smudge, others crack, a few shatter childhoods completely into jagged little pieces, beyond repair.”
Author: Mitch Albom,
Book: The Five People You Meet in Heaven

Quote: “God can't give us peace and happiness apart from Himself because there is no such thing.”
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: “Where there is love, there is often also hate. They can exist side by side.”
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quote: “It's all in the view. That's what I mean about forever, too. For any one of us our forever could end in an hour, or a hundred years from now. You never know for sure, so you'd better make every second count.”
Author: Sarah Dessen,

Quote: “Learn to value yourself, which means: fight for your happiness.”
Author: Ayn Rand

Quote: “I don't know that love changes. People change. Circumstances change.”
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: “Do not be afraid; our fateCannot be taken from us; it is a gift.”
Author: Dante Alighieri,

Quote: “We were like gods at the dawning of the world, & our joy was so bright we could see nothing else but the other.”
Author: Madeline Miller,

Quote: “If you know someone who’s depressed, please resolve never to ask them why. Depression isn’t a straightforward response to a bad situation; depression just is, like the weather.Try to understand the blackness, lethargy, hopelessness, and loneliness they’re going through. Be there for them when they ...
Author: Stephen Fry

Quote: “But it is the nature of stars to cross, and never was Shakespeare more wrong than when he has Cassius note, ‘The fault, dear Brutus, is not in our stars / But in ourselves.”
Author: John Green,

Quote: “Trust is like a mirror, you can fix it if it's broken, but you can still see the crack in that mother fucker's reflection.”
Author: Lady Gaga

Quote: “The truth is what I make it. I could set this world on fire and call it rain.”
Author: Victoria Aveyard,

Quote: “And thus the heart will break, yet brokenly live on.”
Author: George Gordon Byron

Quote: “I'll just have them change the entry in the demonology textbook from 'almost extinct' to 'not extinct enough for Alec. He prefers his monsters really, really extinct.' Will that make you happy?”
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quote: “No persons are more frequently wrong, than those who will not admit they are wrong.”
Author: François de La Rochefoucauld

Quote: “All alone! Whether you like it or not, alone is something you'll be quite a lot!”
Author: Dr. Seuss,
Book: Oh, the Places You'll Go! and The Lorax

Quote: “The world is indeed comic, but the joke is on mankind.”
Author: H. P. Lovecraft

Quote: “This is the way the world endsNot with a bang but a whimper.”
Author: T.S. Eliot

Quote: “Families are messy. Immortal families are eternally messy. Sometimes the best we can do is to remind each other that we're related for better or for worse...and try to keep the maiming and killing to a minimum.”
Author: Rick Riordan,

Quote: “Cry. Forgive. Learn. Move on. Let your tears water the seeds of your future happiness.”
Author: Steve Maraboli

Quote: “So please, oh please, we beg, we pray, go throw your TV set away, and in its place you can install, a lovely bookshelf on the wall.”
Author: Roald Dahl

Quote: “Without suffering, there'd be no compassion.”
Author: Nicholas Sparks,

Quote: “If people refuse to look at you in a new light and they can only see you for what you were, only see you for the mistakes you've made, if they don't realize that you are not your mistakes, then they have to go.”
Author: Steve Maraboli,
Book: Life, the Truth, and Being Free

Quote: “If conversation was the lyrics, laughter was the music, making time spent together a melody that could be replayed over and over without getting stale.”
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: “Fill your paper with the breathings of your heart.”
Author: William Wordsworth

Quote: “A word after a word after a word is power.”
Author: Margaret Atwood

Quote: “We rip out so much of ourselves to be cured of things faster than we should that we go bankrupt by the age of thirty and have less to offer each time we start with someone new. But to feel nothing so as not to feel anything - what a waste!”
Author: Andre Aciman,

Quote: “Beautiful face. Beautiful body. Horrible attitude. It was the holy trinity of hot boys.”
Author: Jennifer L. Armentrout,

Quote: “The saddest people I've ever met in life are the ones who don't care deeply about anything at all. Passion and satisfaction go hand in hand, and without them, any happiness is only temporary, because there's nothing to make it last.”
Author: Nicholas Sparks,
