Quote: “Did you see that dress?” I saw the dress.” Did you like it?” He didn't answer. I took that as a yes. Am I going to endanger my reputation if I wear it to the dance?” When he spoke, I could barely hear him. You'll endanger the school.” I smiled and fell asleep.”
Author: Richelle Mead,

Quote: “Science is not only compatible with spirituality; it is a profound source of spirituality.”
Author: Carl Sagan,
Book: The Demon-Haunted World: Science as a Candle in the Dark

Quote: “Do not read as children do to enjoy themselves, or, as the ambitious do to educate themselves. No, read to live.”
Author: Gustave Flaubert

Quote: “I don’t trust anybody. Not anybody. And the more that I care about someone, the more sure I am they’re going to get tired of me and take off.”
Author: Rainbow Rowell,

Quote: “When we're incomplete, we're always searching for somebody to complete us. When, after a few years or a few months of a relationship, we find that we're still unfulfilled, we blame our partners and take up with somebody more promising. This can go on and on--series polygamy--until we admit that whi...
Author: Tom Robbins

Quote: “I like people too much or not at all. I've got to go down deep, to fall into people, to really know them.”
Author: Sylvia Plath,
Book: The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

Quote: “If I am really a part of your dream, you'll come back one day.”
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: “I hope you will have a wonderful year, that you'll dream dangerously and outrageously, that you'll make something that didn't exist before you made it, that you will be loved and that you will be liked, and that you will have people to love and to like in return. And, most importantly (because I th...
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: “I'd rather be hated for who I am, than loved for who I am not.”
Author: Kurt Cobain

Quote: “I'd rather die my way than live yours.”
Author: Lauren Oliver,

Quote: “Second star to the right and straight on 'til morning. ”
Author: J.M. Barrie,

Quote: “And then I am going to rattle the stars.”
Author: Sarah J. Maas,

Quote: “Whenever you feel like criticizing any one...just remember that all the people in this world haven't had the advantages that you've had.”
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quote: “Ignore those that make you fearful and sad, that degrade you back towards disease and death.”
Author: Rumi Jalalud-Din

Quote: “The voice of the sea speaks to the soul.”
Author: Kate Chopin,

Quote: “Morning is wonderful. Its only drawback is that it comes at such an inconvenient time of day.”
Author: Glen Cook,

Quote: “Parents can only give good advice or put them on the right paths, but the final forming of a person's character lies in their own hands.”
Author: Anne Frank

Quote: “Our lives are not our own. We are bound to others, past and present, and by each crime and every kindness, we birth our future.”
Author: David Mitchell,

Quote: “Always be a poet, even in prose.”
Author: Charles Baudelaire

Quote: “Life before Death.Strength before Weakness.Journey before Destination.”
Author: Brandon Sanderson,

Quote: “For me, I am driven by two main philosophies: know more today about the world than I knew yesterday and lessen the suffering of others. You'd be surprised how far that gets you.”
Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

Quote: “Mental pain is less dramatic than physical pain, but it is more common and also more hard to bear. The frequent attempt to conceal mental pain increases the burden: it is easier to say “My tooth is aching” than to say “My heart is broken.”
Author: C.S. Lewis,

Quote: “It would seem that Our Lord finds our desires not too strong, but too weak. We are half-hearted creatures, fooling about with drink and sex and ambition when infinite joy is offered us, like an ignorant child who wants to go on making mud pies in a slum because he cannot imagine what is meant by th...
Author: C.S. Lewis,
Book: The Weight of Glory, and Other Addresses

Quote: “Nothing behind me, everything ahead of me, as is ever so on the road.”
Author: Jack Kerouac,

Quote: “Headline? he asked.'Swing Set Needs Home,' I said.'Desperately Lonely Swing Set Needs Loving Home,' he said.'Lonely, Vaguely Pedophilic Swing Set Seeks the Butts of Children,' I said.”
Author: John Green,

Quote: “My rapier wit hides my inner pain.”
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: “The advantage of a bad memory is that one enjoys several times the same good things for the first time.”
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: “Holding anger is a poison...It eats you from inside...We think that by hating someone we hurt them...But hatred is a curved blade...and the harm we do to others...we also do to ourselves.”
Author: Mitch Albom,
Book: The Five People You Meet in Heaven

Quote: “He awoke each morning with the desire to do right, to be a good and meaningful person, to be, as simple as it sounded and as impossible as it actually was, happy. And during the course of each day his heart would descend from his chest into his stomach. By early afternoon he was overcome by the fee...
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,

Quote: “You forget what you want to remember, and you remember what you want to forget.”
Author: Cormac McCarthy,

Quote: “A small but noteworthy note. I've seen so many young men over the years who think they're running at other young men. They are not. They are running at me.”
Author: Markus Zusak,

Quote: “Life starts all over again when it gets crisp in the fall.”
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,

Quote: “Silence, I discover, is something you can actually hear.”
Author: Haruki Murakami,

Quote: “In my next life I want to live my life backwards. You start out dead and get that out of the way. Then you wake up in an old people's home feeling better every day. You get kicked out for being too healthy, go collect your pension, and then when you start work, you get a gold watch and a party on y...
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: “I sit beside the fire and think Of all that I have seenOf meadow flowers and butterfliesIn summers that have beenOf yellow leaves and gossamerIn autumns that there wereWith morning mist and silver sunAnd wind upon my hairI sit beside the fire and thinkOf how the world will beWhen winter comes witho...
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien

Quote: “If you liked being a teenager, there's something really wrong with you.”
Author: Stephen King

Quote: “The best way to cheer yourself is to try to cheer someone else up.”
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: “Those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.”
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: “Did you really want to die?No one commits suicide because they want to die.Then why do they do it?Because they want to stop the pain.”
Author: Tiffanie DeBartolo,
Book: How to Kill a Rock Star

Quote: “There must be something in books, something we can’t imagine, to make a woman stay in a burning house; there must be something there. You don’t stay for nothing.”
Author: Ray Bradbury,

Quote: “If you want a picture of the future, imagine a boot stamping on a human face—for ever.”
Author: George Orwell,

Quote: “If everybody is thinking alike, then somebody isn't thinking.”
Author: George S. Patton

Quote: “They're certainly entitled to think that, and they're entitled to full respect for their opinions... but before I can live with other folks I've got to live with myself. The one thing that doesn't abide by majority rule is a person's conscience.”
Author: Harper Lee,

Quote: “Some walks you have to take alone.”
Author: Suzanne Collins,

Quote: “Sorrow is how we learn to love. Your heart isn't breaking. It hurts because it's getting larger. The larger it gets, the more love it holds.”
Author: Rita Mae Brown,

Quote: “You care so much you feel as though you will bleed to death with the pain of it.”
Author: J.K. Rowling,
Book: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

Quote: “All happiness depends on courage and work.”
Author: Honoré de Balzac

Quote: “The two hardest tests on the spiritual road are the patience to wait for the right moment and the courage not to be disappointed with what we encounter.”
Author: Paulo Coelho,

Quote: “The more I read, the more I acquire, the more certain I am that I know nothing.”
Author: Voltaire

Quote: “Sometimes I wonder if there's something wrong with me. Perhaps I've spent too long in the company of my literary romantic heroes, and consequently my ideals and expectations are far too high.”
Author: E.L. James,

Quote: “The only real prison is fear, and the only real freedom is freedom from fear”
Author: Aung San Suu Kyi

Quote: “Holding Eleanor's hand was like holding a butterfly. Or a heartbeat. Like holding something complete, and completely alive.”
Author: Rainbow Rowell,

Quote: “I get a warm feeling among my books.”
Author: Anthony Powell

Quote: “Once you have read a book you care about, some part of it is always with you.”
Author: Louis L'Amour,
Book: Matagorda/The First Fast Draw: Two Novels in One Volume

Quote: “Can you surf really well, then?I looked at Grover, who was trying hard not to laugh.Jeez, Nico, I said. I've never really tried.He went on asking questions. Did I fight a lot with Thalia, since she was a daughter of Zeus? (I didn't answer that one.) If Annabeth's mother was Athena, the goddess of w...
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: “The last enemy that shall be destroyed is death.”
Author: J.K. Rowling,
Book: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

Quote: “Reality doesn't impress me. I only believe in intoxication, in ecstasy, and when ordinary life shackles me, I escape, one way or another. No more walls.”
Author: Anaïs Nin,
Book: Incest: From "A Journal of Love": The Unexpurgated Diary of Anaïs Nin, 1932-1934

Quote: “I think; therefore I am.”
Author: Rene Descartes

Quote: “أي علم هذا الذي لم يستطع حتى الآن أن يضع أصوات من نحب في أقراص ، أو زجاجة دواء نتناولها سرًّا ، عندما نصاب بوعكة عاطفية بدون أن يدري صاحبها كم نحن نحتاجه”
Author: أحلام مستغانمي,

Quote: “It doesn't matter. I have books, new books, and I can bear anything as long as there are books.”
Author: Jo Walton,

Quote: “Even After All this timeThe Sun never says to the Earth,You owe me.LookWhat happensWith a love like that,It lights the whole sky.”
Author: Hafiz

Quote: “I wonder how many people don't get the one they want, but end up with the one they're supposed to be with.”
Author: Fannie Flagg,
Book: Fried Green Tomatoes at the Whistle Stop Cafe

Quote: “Every day is a new day. It is better to be lucky. But I would rather be exact. Then when luck comes you are ready.”
Author: Ernest Hemingway,
Book: The Old Man and the Sea

Quote: “The good thing about science is that it's true whether or not you believe in it.”
Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

Quote: “Scars have the strange power to remind us that our past is real.”
Author: Cormac McCarthy,

Quote: “All good books are alike in that they are truer than if they had really happened and after you are finished reading one you will feel that all that happened to you and afterwards it all belongs to you: the good and the bad, the ecstasy, the remorse and sorrow, the people and the places and how the ...
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: “I have nothing to declare except my genius.”
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: “Books serve to show a man that those original thoughts of his aren't very new after all.”
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: “Don't aim at success. The more you aim at it and make it a target, the more you are going to miss it. For success, like happiness, cannot be pursued; it must ensue, and it only does so as the unintended side effect of one's personal dedication to a cause greater than oneself or as the by-product of...
Author: Viktor E. Frankl,

Quote: “Fire-breathing bitch-queen.”
Author: Sarah J. Maas,

Quote: “Maybe our girlfriends are our soulmates and guys are just people to have fun with.”
Author: Candace Bushnell,

Quote: “He died not for men, but for each man. If each man had been the only man made, He would have done no less.”
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: “Hope is a waking dream.”
Author: Aristotle

Quote: “I believe in God, but not as one thing, not as an old man in the sky. I believe that what people call God is something in all of us. I believe that what Jesus and Mohammed and Buddha and all the rest said was right. It's just that the translations have gone wrong.”
Author: John Lennon

Quote: “make a radical change in your lifestyle and begin to boldly do things which you may previously never have thought of doing, or been too hesitant to attempt. So many people live within unhappy circumstances and yet will not take the initiative to change their situation because they are conditioned t...
Author: Jon Krakauer,

Quote: “Heard melodies are sweet, but those unheard, are sweeter”
Author: John Keats,
Book: Ode On A Grecian Urn And Other Poems

Quote: “The only lies for which we are truly punished are those we tell ourselves.”
Author: V. S. Naipaul,

Quote: “All right, said Susan. I'm not stupid. You're saying humans need... fantasies to make life bearable.REALLY? AS IF IT WAS SOME KIND OF PINK PILL? NO. HUMANS NEED FANTASY TO BE HUMAN. TO BE THE PLACE WHERE THE FALLING ANGEL MEETS THE RISING APE.Tooth fairies? Hogfathers? Little—YES. AS PRACTICE. YOU ...
Author: Terry Pratchett,

Quote: “Instructions for living a life. Pay attention. Be astonished. Tell about it.”
Author: Mary Oliver

Quote: “But I didn't understand then. That I could hurt somebody so badly she would never recover. That a person can, just by living, damage another human being beyond repair.”
Author: Haruki Murakami

Quote: “Anybody can sympathise with the sufferings of a friend, but it requires a very fine nature to sympathise with a friend's success.”
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: “We learn from failure, not from success!”
Author: Bram Stoker,

Quote: “At the end of the day, we can endure much more than we think we can.”
Author: Frida Kahlo

Quote: “I don't know who invented high heels, but all women owe him a lot!”
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: “A love like that was a serious illness, an illness from which you never entirely recover.”
Author: Charles Bukowski,
Book: The People Look Like Flowers at Last

Quote: “Stars, hide your fires; Let not light see my black and deep desires.”
Author: William Shakespeare,

Quote: “Maybe some people are just meant to be in the same story.”
Author: Jandy Nelson,

Quote: “Trains are great dirty smoky things, said Will. You won't like it. Tessa was unmoved. I won't know if I like it until I try it, will I? I've never swum naked in the Thames before, but I know I wouldn't like it. But think how entertaining for sightseers, said Tessa, and she saw Jem duck his head to ...
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quote: “Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough.”
Author: Oprah Winfrey

Quote: “I know of a cure for everything: salt water...in one way or the other. Sweat, or tears, or the salt sea.”
Author: Karen Blixen

Quote: “If, then, I were asked for the most important advice I could give, that which I considered to be the most useful to the men of our century, I should simply say: in the name of God, stop a moment, cease your work, look around you.”
Author: Leo Tolstoy,

Quote: “Man is the cruelest animal.”
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: “No great mind has ever existed without a touch of madness.”
Author: Aristotle

Quote: “An Unbreakable Vow? said Ron, looking stunned. Nah, he can’t have.... Are you sure?Yes I’m sure, said Harry. Why, what does it mean?Well, you can’t break an Unbreakable Vow...I’d worked that much out for myself, funnily enough.”
Author: J.K. Rowling,
Book: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

Quote: “There are three questions every woman should be able to answer yes to before they commit to a man. If you answer no to any of the three questions, run like hell.[...]Does he treat you with respect at all times? That's the first question. The second question is, if he is the exact same person twenty...
Author: Colleen Hoover,

Quote: “Marriage can wait, education cannot.”
Author: Khaled Hosseini,

Quote: “An intellectual? Yes. And never deny it. An intellectual is someone whose mind watches itself. I like this, because I am happy to be both halves, the watcher and the watched. Can they be brought together? This is a practical question. We must get down to it. I despise intelligence really means: I c...
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: “You make me want to live, Rowan. Not survive; not exist. Live.”
Author: Sarah J. Maas,

Quote: “Fiction is the lie through which we tell the truth.”
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: “Absence diminishes small loves and increases great ones, as the wind blows out the candle and fans the bonfire.”
Author: Francois Duc de la Rochefoucauld,

Quote: “...you know that a good, long session of weeping can often make you feel better, even if your circumstances have not changed one bit.”
Author: Lemony Snicket,

Quote: “I love you, not just for now, but for always, and I dream of the day that you’ll take me in your arms again.”
Author: Nicholas Sparks,

Quote: “The future depends on what you do today.”
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: “I'm killing time while I wait for life to shower me with meaning and happiness.”
Author: Bill Watterson

Quote: “Patience, grasshopper, said Maia. Good things come to those who wait.I always thought that was 'Good things come to those who do the wave,' said Simon. No wonder I've been so confused all my life.”
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quote: “Intelligence plus character-that is the goal of true education.”
Author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Quote: “Do you think that I count the days? There is only one day left, always starting over: it is given to us at dawn and taken away from us at dusk.”
Author: Jean-Paul Sartre

Quote: “Come home and shout at me. Come home and fight with me. Come home and break my heart, if you must.”
Author: Holly Black,

Quote: “You should write because you love the shape of stories and sentences and the creation of different words on a page. Writing comes from reading, and reading is the finest teacher of how to write.”
Author: Annie Proulx

Quote: “Tiger got to hunt, bird got to fly;Man got to sit and wonder 'why, why, why?'Tiger got to sleep, bird got to land;Man got to tell himself he understand.”
Author: Kurt Vonnegut,

Quote: “The homemaker has the ultimate career. All other careers exist for one purpose only - and that is to support the ultimate career. ”
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: “The things you used to own, now they own you.”
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,

Quote: “This is how you do it: you sit down at the keyboard and you put one word after another until its done. It's that easy, and that hard.”
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: “you have to love something before you can hate it.”
Author: Nicholas Sparks,

Quote: “The power of a glance has been so much abused in love stories, that it has come to be disbelieved in. Few people dare now to say that two beings have fallen in love because they have looked at each other. Yet it is in this way that love begins, and in this way only.”
Author: Victor Hugo,

Quote: “I’m not in this world to live up to your expectations and you’re not in this world to live up to mine.”
Author: Bruce Lee

Quote: “Anti-intellectualism has been a constant thread winding its way through our political and cultural life, nurtured by the false notion that democracy means that 'my ignorance is just as good as your knowledge.'”
Author: Isaac Asimov

Quote: “Books are no more threatened by Kindle than stairs by elevators.”
Author: Stephen Fry

Quote: “When someone is in your heart, they're never truly gone. They can come back to you, even at unlikely times.”
Author: Mitch Albom,

Quote: “Have you ever asked yourself, do monsters make war, or does war make monsters?”
Author: Laini Taylor,

Quote: “To put everything in balance is good, to put everything in harmony is better.”
Author: Victor Hugo

Quote: “A man's face is his autobiography. A woman's face is her work of fiction.”
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: “Either you deal with what is the reality, or you can be sure that the reality is going to deal with you.”
Author: Alex Haley

Quote: “The future is now. It's time to grow up and be strong. Tomorrow may well be too late.”
Author: Neil LaBute,

Quote: “If death meant just leaving the stage long enough to change costume and come back as a new character...Would you slow down? Or speed up?”
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,

Quote: “The only truth is music.”
Author: Jack Kerouac

Quote: “It is nothing to die. It is frightful not to live.”
Author: Victor Hugo,

Quote: “Wanting to be someone else is a waste of the person you are.”
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: “You’re dangerous,” he says.“Why?”“Because you make me believe in the impossible”
Author: Simone Elkeles,

Quote: “Alone. Yes, that's the key word, the most awful word in the English tongue. Murder doesn't hold a candle to it and hell is only a poor synonym.”
Author: Stephen King

Quote: “A paranoid is someone who knows a little of what's going on. ”
Author: William S. Burroughs

Quote: “What is family? They were the people who claimed you. In good, in bad, in parts or in whole, they were the ones who showed up, who stayed in there, regardless. It wasn't just about blood relations or shared chromosomes, but something wider, bigger. We had many families over time. Our family of orig...
Author: Sarah Dessen,

Quote: “He felt that his whole life was some kind of dream and he sometimes wondered whose it was and whether they were enjoying it.”
Author: Douglas Adams,
Book: The Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy

Quote: “Incredible change happens in your life when you decide to take control of what you do have power over instead of craving control over what you don't.”
Author: Steve Maraboli,
Book: Life, the Truth, and Being Free

Quote: “Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss, you'll land among the stars.”
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: “Men go to far greater lengths to avoid what they fear than to obtain what they desire.”
Author: Dan Brown,

Quote: “When you have lost hope, you have lost everything. And when you think all is lost, when all is dire and bleak, there is always hope.”
Author: Pittacus Lore,

Quote: “Most men would rather deny a hard truth than face it.”
Author: George R.R. Martin,

Quote: “The best way to cheer yourself is to cheer somebody else up.”
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: “And then something invisible snapped insider her, and that which had come together commenced to fall apart.”
Author: John Green,

Quote: “Keep your face always toward the sunshine - and shadows will fall behind you.”
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: “Courage isn't having the strength to go on - it is going on when you don't have strength.”
Author: Napoleon Bonaparte

Quote: “If the real world were a book, it would never find a publisher. Overlong, detailed to the point of distraction-and ultimately, without a major resolution.”
Author: Jasper Fforde,

Quote: “The water hears and understands. The ice does not forgive.”
Author: Leigh Bardugo,

Quote: “If you want to get laid, go to college. If you want an education, go to the library.”
Author: Frank Zappa

Quote: “What a blessing it is to love books as I love them;- to be able to converse with the dead, and to live amidst the unreal!”
Author: Thomas Babington Macaulay,
Book: The Selected Letters of Thomas Babington Macaulay

Quote: “People speak sometimes about the bestial cruelty of man, but that is terribly unjust and offensive to beasts, no animal could ever be so cruel as a man, so artfully, so artistically cruel.”
Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

Quote: “By you, I am forever undone.”
Author: Holly Black,

Quote: “The most certain sign of wisdom is cheerfulness. ”
Author: Michel de Montaigne

Quote: “We shall meet in the place where there is no darkness.”
Author: George Orwell,

Quote: “there is a place in the heart thatwill never be filleda spaceand even during thebest momentsandthe greatest timestimeswe will know itwe will know itmore thaneverthere is a place in the heart thatwill never be filledandwe will waitandwaitin that space.”
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: “A person often meets his destiny on the road he took to avoid it.”
Author: Jean de La Fontaine,

Quote: “Dignity/ˈdignitē/ noun 1. The moment you realize that the person you cared for has nothing intellectually or spiritually to offer you, but a headache. 2. The moment you realize God had greater plans for you that don’t involve crying at night or sad Pinterest quotes.3. The moment you stop comparing ...
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: “I’ve been fighting to be who I am all my life. What’s the point of being who I am, if I can’t have the person who was worth all the fighting for?”
Author: Stephanie Lennox,

Quote: “I hope that one day you will have the experience of doing something you do not understand for someone you love.”
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,

Quote: “When will you learn that there isn't a word for everything?”
Author: Nicole Krauss,

Quote: “No winter lasts forever; no spring skips its turn.”
Author: Hal Borland

Quote: “لا تجالس أنصاف العشاق، ولا تصادق أنصاف الأصدقاء، لا تقرأ لأنصاف الموهوبين،لا تعش نصف حياة، ولا تمت نصف موت،لا تختر نصف حل، ولا تقف في منتصف الحقيقة، لا تحلم نصف حلم، ولا تتعلق بنصف أمل، إذا صمتّ.. فاصمت حتى النهاية، وإذا تكلمت.. فتكلّم حتى النهاية، لا تصمت كي تتكلم، ولا تتكلم كي تصمت. إذا رضيت فعبّ...
Author: جبران خليل جبران

Quote: “Trees that are slow to grow bear the best fruit.”
Author: Moliere

Quote: “You're the first Shadowhunter I've ever met. “That’s too bad,” said Jace, “since all the others you meet from now on will be a terrible letdown.”
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quote: “A bit of trash now and then is good for the severest reader. It provides the necessary roughage in the literary diet.”
Author: Phyllis McGinley

Quote: “Nothing travels faster than the speed of light, with the possible exception of bad news, which obeys its own special laws.”
Author: Douglas Adams,

Quote: “It's going to be all right, sir, Harry said over and over again, more worried by Dumbledore's silence than he had been by his weakened voice. We're nearly there ... I can Apparate us both back ... don't worry ...I am not worried, Harry, said Dumbledore, his voice a little stronger despite the freez...
Author: J.K. Rowling,
Book: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

Quote: “there are two types of people in the world: those who prefer to be sad among others, and those who prefer to be sad alone.”
Author: Nicole Krauss,

Quote: “I am not what happened to me, I am what I choose to become.”
Author: Carl Gustav Jung

Quote: “Alec looked at her and shook his head. How do you manage never to get mud on your clothes?Isabelle shrugged philosophically. I'm pure at heart. It repels the dirt.”
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quote: “I hate men who are afraid of women's strength.”
Author: Anaïs Nin,
Book: Henry and June: The Unexpurgated Diary of Anaïs Nin, 1931-1932

Quote: “Open a book this minute and start reading. Don’t move until you’ve reached page fifty. Until you’ve buried your thoughts in print. Cover yourself with words. Wash yourself away. Dissolve.”
Author: Carol Shields,

Quote: “I was dead until you found me, though I breathed. I was sightless, though I could see. And then you came...and I was awakened.”
Author: J.R. Ward,

Quote: “Have you ever lost someone you love and wanted one more conversation, one more chance to make up for the time when you thought they would be here forever? If so, then you know you can go your whole life collecting days, and none will outweigh the one you wish you had back.”
Author: Mitch Albom,

Quote: “Whoever is careless with the truth in small matters cannot be trusted with important matters”
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: “Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months.”
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: “There are much worse games to play.”
Author: Suzanne Collins,

Quote: “It's so much darker when a light goes out than it would have been if it had never shone.”
Author: John Steinbeck,

Quote: “Whenever people agree with me I always feel I must be wrong.”
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: “Magnus, standing by the door, snapped his fingers impatiently. Move it along, teenagers. The only person who gets to canoodle in my bedroom is my magnificent self.Canoodle? repeated Clary, never having heard the word before.Magnificent? repeated Jace, who was just being nasty. Magnus growled. The g...
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quote: “You alone are enough. You have nothing to prove to anybody.”
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: “I am both happy and sad at the same time, and I'm still trying to figure out how that could be.”
Author: Stephen Chbosky,
Book: The Perks of Being a Wallflower

Quote: “The best way to not feel hopeless is to get up and do something. Don’t wait for good things to happen to you. If you go out and make some good things happen, you will fill the world with hope, you will fill yourself with hope.”
Author: Barack Obama

Quote: “We can't be afraid of change. You may feel very secure in the pond that you are in, but if you never venture out of it, you will never know that there is such a thing as an ocean, a sea. Holding onto something that is good for you now, may be the very reason why you don't have something better.”
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: “The impossible could not have happened, therefore the impossible must be possible in spite of appearances.”
Author: Agatha Christie,

Quote: “The earth has its music for those who will listen”
Author: Reginald Vincent Holmes,

Quote: “You might want to lie down, Magnus advised. I find that it helps when the crushing sense of horrible realization sets in.”
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quote: “I know not all that may be coming, but be it what it will, I'll go to it laughing.”
Author: Herman Melville,

Quote: “to love life, to love it evenwhen you have no stomach for itand everything you've held dearcrumbles like burnt paper in your hands,your throat filled with the silt of it.When grief sits with you, its tropical heatthickening the air, heavy as watermore fit for gills than lungs;when grief weights you...
Author: Ellen Bass

Quote: “And Lot's wife, of course, was told not to look back where all those people and their homes had been. But she did look back, and I love her for that, because it was so human. So she was turned into a pillar of salt. So it goes.”
Author: Kurt Vonnegut,

Quote: “Don't cry over someone who wouldn't cry over you.”
Author: Lauren Conrad

Quote: “God does not play dice with the universe; He plays an ineffable game of His own devising, which might be compared, from the perspective of any of the other players [i.e. everybody], to being involved in an obscure and complex variant of poker in a pitch-dark room, with blank cards, for infinite sta...
Author: Terry Pratchett,
Book: Good Omens: The Nice and Accurate Prophecies of Agnes Nutter, Witch

Quote: “Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.”
Author: Helen Keller,

Quote: “There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that receives it.”
Author: Edith Wharton

Quote: “I want to be in a relationship where you telling me you love me is just a ceremonious validation of what you already show me.”
Author: Steve Maraboli,
Book: Life, the Truth, and Being Free

Quote: “Let the rain kiss you. Let the rain beat upon your head with silver liquid drops. Let the rain sing you a lullaby.”
Author: Langston Hughes

Quote: “I don’t know what’s worse: to not know what you are and be happy, or to become what you’ve always wanted to be, and feel alone.”
Author: Daniel Keyes,

Quote: “There is nothing like looking, if you want to find something. You certainly usually find something, if you look, but it is not always quite the something you were after.”
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,
Book: The Hobbit, or There and Back Again

Quote: “You deal with mythological stuff for a few years, you learn that paradises are usually places where you get killed.”
Author: Rick Riordan,

Quote: “Do you not see how necessary a world of pains and troubles is to school an intelligence and make it a soul?”
Author: John Keats,

Quote: “Why are you worrying about YOU-KNOW-WHO, when you should be worrying about YOU-NO-POO? The constipation sensation that's gripping the nation!”
Author: J.K. Rowling,
Book: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

Quote: “It isn't what we say or think that defines us, but what we do.”
Author: Jane Austen,

Quote: “There is more than one way to burn a book. And the world is full of people running about with lit matches.”
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quote: “I am a forest, and a night of dark trees: but he who is not afraid of my darkness, will find banks full of roses under my cypresses.”
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche,

Quote: “Great minds discuss ideas. Average minds discuss events. Small minds discuss people.”
Author: Henry Thomas Buckle

Quote: “You’ll miss the best things if you keep your eyes shut.”
Author: Dr. Seuss,
Book: I Can Read with My Eyes Shut!

Quote: “I write to give myself strength. I write to be the characters that I am not. I write to explore all the things I'm afraid of. ”
Author: Joss Whedon

Quote: “You think because he doesn't love you that you are worthless. You think that because he doesn't want you anymore that he is right -- that his judgement and opinion of you are correct. If he throws you out, then you are garbage. You think he belongs to you because you want to belong to him. Don't. I...
Author: Toni Morrison

Quote: “When you consider things like the stars, our affairs don't seem to matter very much, do they?”
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: “When we are young, the words are scattered all around us. As they are assembled by experience, so also are we, sentence by sentence, until the story takes shape.”
Author: Louise Erdrich,

Quote: “She feels in italics and thinks in CAPITALS.”
Author: Henry James

Quote: “You can only be young once. But you can always be immature.”
Author: Pat  Monahan

Quote: “When they asked me what I wanted to be I said I didn’t know.Oh, sure you know, the photographer said.She wants, said Jay Cee wittily, to be everything.”
Author: Sylvia Plath,

Quote: “If no one cares for you at all, do you even really exist?”
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quote: “Stories you read when you're the right age never quite leave you. You may forget who wrote them or what the story was called. Sometimes you'll forget precisely what happened, but if a story touches you it will stay with you, haunting the places in your mind that you rarely ever visit.”
Author: Neil Gaiman,

Quote: “Grown-ups never understand anything by themselves, and it is tiresome for children to be always and forever explaining things to them”
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,

Quote: “When I look at my life and its secret colours, I feel like bursting into tears.”
Author: Albert Camus,

Quote: “Watch out for intellect,because it knows so much it knows nothingand leaves you hanging upside down,mouthing knowledge as your heartfalls out of your mouth.”
Author: Anne Sexton,

Quote: “It is easy in the world to live after the world's opinion; it is easy in solitude to live after our own; but the great man is he who in the midst of the crowd keeps with perfect sweetness the independence of solitude.”
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,
Book: The Complete Prose Works Of Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: “You’ll get over it…” It’s the clichés that cause the trouble. To lose someone you love is to alter your life for ever. You don’t get over it because ‘it” is the person you loved. The pain stops, there are new people, but the gap never closes. How could it? The particularness of someone who mattered...
Author: Jeanette Winterson,

Quote: “If you never did you should. These things are fun and fun is good.”
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: “Freedom lies in being bold.”
Author: Robert Frost

Quote: “He who knows all the answers has not been asked all the questions.”
Author: Confucius

Quote: “The thing that makes you exceptional, if you are at all, is inevitably that which must also make you lonely.”
Author: Lorraine Hansberry

Quote: “The worst type of crying wasn't the kind everyone could see--the wailing on street corners, the tearing at clothes. No, the worst kind happened when your soul wept and no matter what you did, there was no way to comfort it. A section withered and became a scar on the part of your soul that survived...
Author: Katie McGarry,

Quote: “I know it's wrong - God, it's all kinds of wrong - but I just want to lie down with you and wake up with you, just once, just once ever in my life.”
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quote: “ليس هناك كتابا أقرأه و لا أستفيد منه شيئا جديدا ، فحتى الكتاب التافه أستفيد من قراءته ، أني تعلمت شيئا جديدا هو ما هي التفاهة ؟ و كيف يكتب الكتاب التافهون ؟ و فيم يفكرون ؟”
Author: عباس محمود العقاد

Quote: “We do not believe in ourselves until someone reveals that deep inside us something is valuable, worth listening to, worthy of our trust, sacred to our touch. Once we believe in ourselves we can risk curiosity, wonder, spontaneous delight or any experience that reveals the human spirit.”
Author: E.E. Cummings

Quote: “All a girl really wants is for one guy to prove to her that they are not all the same.”
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: “There are moments when troubles enter our lives and we can do nothing to avoid them.But they are there for a reason. Only when we have overcome them will we understand why they were there.”
Author: Paulo Coelho,

Quote: “Laughter is wine for the soul - laughter soft, or loud and deep, tinged through with seriousness - the hilarious declaration made by man that life is worth living.”
Author: Sean O'Casey

Quote: “Atticus said to Jem one day, I’d rather you shot at tin cans in the backyard, but I know you’ll go after birds. Shoot all the blue jays you want, if you can hit ‘em, but remember it’s a sin to kill a mockingbird. That was the only time I ever heard Atticus say it was a sin to do something, and I as...
Author: Harper Lee,

Quote: “A person who has good thoughts cannot ever be ugly. You can have a wonky nose and a crooked mouth and a double chin and stick-out teeth, but if you have good thoughts they will shine out of your face like sunbeams and you will always look lovely.”
Author: Roald Dahl,

Quote: “But the Hebrew word, the word timshel—‘Thou mayest’— that gives a choice. It might be the most important word in the world. That says the way is open. That throws it right back on a man. For if ‘Thou mayest’—it is also true that ‘Thou mayest not.”
Author: John Steinbeck,

Quote: “If he loved with all the powers of his puny being, he couldn't love as much in eighty years as I could in a day.”
Author: Emily Brontë,

Quote: “You will lose what you value most, so treasure it while you can.”
Author: Richelle Mead,

Quote: “A mother is the truest friend we have, when trials heavy and sudden fall upon us; when adversity takes the place of prosperity; when friends desert us; when trouble thickens around us, still will she cling to us, and endeavor by her kind precepts and counsels to dissipate the clouds of darkness, an...
Author: Washington Irving

Quote: “There are nights when the wolves are silent and only the moon howls. ”
Author: George Carlin

Quote: “I decided as long as I'm going to hell, I might as well do it thoroughly.”
Author: Stephenie Meyer,

Quote: “Only you can control your future.”
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: “Behind this mask there is more than just flesh. Beneath this mask there is an idea... and ideas are bulletproof.”
Author: Alan Moore,

Quote: “Lovers don't finally meet somewhere. They're in each other all along.”
Author: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

Quote: “When people say impossible, they usually mean improbable.”
Author: Leigh Bardugo,

Quote: “To do the useful thing, to say the courageous thing, to contemplate the beautiful thing: that is enough for one man's life.”
Author: T.S. Eliot,
Book: The Use of Poetry and the Use of Criticism

Quote: “If you have the words, there's always a chance that you'll find the way.”
Author: Seamus Heaney,
Book: Stepping Stones: Interviews with Seamus Heaney

Quote: “When I do good, I feel good. When I do bad, I feel bad. That's my religion.”
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: “Only a generation of readers will spawn a generation of writers.”
Author: Steven Spielberg

Quote: “This is a new year. A new beginning. And things will change.”
Author: Taylor Swift

Quote: “How long was I asleep? she whispered. He didn't respond. How long was I asleep? she asked again, and noticed a hint of red in his cheeks. You were asleep, too? Until you began drooling on my shoulder.”
Author: Sarah J. Maas,

Quote: “You live like this, sheltered, in a delicate world, and you believe you are living. Then you read a book… or you take a trip… and you discover that you are not living, that you are hibernating. The symptoms of hibernating are easily detectable: first, restlessness. The second symptom (when hibernat...
Author: Anaïs Nin,
Book: The Diary of Anaïs Nin, Vol. 1: 1931-1934

Quote: “Never miss a good chance to shut up.”
Author: Will Rogers

Quote: “We do not need magic to transform our world. We carry all of the power we need inside ourselves already.”
Author: J.K. Rowling,
Book: Very Good Lives: The Fringe Benefits of Failure and the Importance of Imagination

Quote: “Do not train a child to learn by force or harshness; but direct them to it by what amuses their minds, so that you may be better able to discover with accuracy the peculiar bent of the genius of each.”
Author: Plato

Quote: “When someone you love dies, and you're not expecting it, you don't lose her all at once; you lose her in pieces over a long time—the way the mail stops coming, and her scent fades from the pillows and even from the clothes in her closet and drawers. Gradually, you accumulate the parts of her that a...
Author: John Irving,

Quote: “Your assumptions are your windows on the world. Scrub them off every once in a while, or the light won't come in.”
Author: Alan Alda

Quote: “The best way out is always through.”
Author: Robert Frost

Quote: “All thinking men are atheists.”
Author: Ernest Hemingway,

Quote: “It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen.”
Author: George Orwell,

Quote: “Never let anyone make you feel ordinary.”
Author: Taylor Jenkins Reid,
Book: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo

Quote: “Look at everything always as though you were seeing it either for the first or last time: Thus is your time on earth filled with glory.”
Author: Betty Smith,

Quote: “It is better, I think, to grab at the stars than to sit flustered because you know you cannot reach them.”
Author: R.A. Salvatore,

Quote: “Five exclamation marks, the sure sign of an insane mind.”
Author: Terry Pratchett,

Quote: “Sometimes love means letting go when you want to hold on tighter.”
Author: Melissa Marr,

Quote:
“I got schooled this yearbyaboy.A boy that I'm seriously, deeply, madly, incredibly, and undeniably in 
love
 with.And he taught me the most important thing of all...To put the emphasisOn 
life
.”
Author: Colleen Hoover,

Quote: “I don't go out with strangers, I said.Good thing I do. I'll pick you up at five.”
Author: Becca Fitzpatrick,

Quote: “You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club.”
Author: Jack London

Quote: “Believe in your infinite potential. Your only limitations are those you set upon yourself.”
Author: Roy T. Bennett,

Quote: “When you trip over love, it is easy to get up. But when you fall in love, it is impossible to stand again.”
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: “The past is never where you think you left it.”
Author: Katherine Anne Porter

Quote: “Many people will walk in and out of your life, but only true friends will leave footprints in your heart”
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: “Well-read people are less likely to be evil.”
Author: Lemony Snicket,

Quote: “A well-composed book is a magic carpet on which we are wafted to a world that we cannot enter in any other way.”
Author: Caroline Gordon

Quote: “The more clearly we can focus our attention on the wonders and realities of the universe about us, the less taste we shall have for destruction.”
Author: Rachel Carson

Quote: “I like this place and could willingly waste my time in it.”
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: “The thing I realize is, that it's not what you take, it's what you leave.”
Author: Jennifer Niven,

Quote: “Usually we walk around constantly believing ourselves. I'm okay we say. I'm alright. But sometimes the truth arrives on you and you can't get it off. That's when you realize that sometimes it isn't even an answer--it's a question. Even now, I wonder how much of my life is convinced.”
Author: Markus Zusak,

Quote: “If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself, but to your estimate of it; and this you have the power to revoke at any moment.”
Author: Marcus Aurelius,

Quote: “Dreams are always crushing when they don't come true. But it's the simple dreams that are often the most painful because they seem so personal, so reasonable, so attainable. You're always close enough to touch, but never quite close enough to hold and it's enough to break your heart.”
Author: Nicholas Sparks,

Quote: “Be glad. Be good. Be brave.”
Author: Eleanor Hodgman Porter

Quote: “Real generosity towards the future lies in giving all to the present.”
Author: Albert Camus,

Quote: “What is right is not always popular and what is popular is not always right.”
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: “Jane, be still; don't struggle so like a wild, frantic bird, that is rending its own plumage in its desperation.I am no bird; and no net ensnares me; I am a free human being, with an independent will; which I now exert to leave you.”
Author: Charlotte Brontë ,

Quote: “He was the crazy one who had painted himself black and defeated the world.She was the book thief without the words.Trust me, though, the words were on their way, and when they arrived, Liesel would hold them in her hands like the clouds, and she would wring them out like rain.”
Author: Markus Zusak,

Quote: “If someone were to harm my family or a friend or somebody I love, I would eat them. I might end up in jail for 500 years, but I would eat them.”
Author: Johnny Depp

Quote: “As long as she thinks of a man, nobody objects to a woman thinking.”
Author: Virginia Woolf,

Quote: “Maybe this world is another planet’s hell.”
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: “Feminism is the radical notion that women are human beings.”
Author: Cheris Kramarae

Quote: “Luxury is not a necessity to me, but beautiful and good things are.”
Author: Anais Nin

Quote: “Literature is a textually transmitted disease, normally contracted in childhood.”
Author: Jane Yolen,
Book: Touch Magic: Fantasy, Faerie & Folklore in the Literature of Childhood

Quote: “If I read a book and it makes my whole body so cold no fire can ever warm me, I know that is poetry.”
Author: Emily Dickinson

Quote: “You are okay? he asked. Not eaten by monsters?Not even a little bit. I showed him that I still had both arms and both legs, and Tyson clapped happily.Yay! he said. Now we can eat peanut butter sandwiches and ride fish ponies! We can fight monsters and see Annabeth and make things go BOOM!I hoped he...
Author: Rick Riordan,

Quote: “It is not the length of life, but the depth.”
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: “A man is but the product of his thoughts. What he thinks, he becomes.”
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: “District 12: Where you can starve to death in safety.”
Author: Suzanne Collins,

Quote: “I am beginning to learn that it is the sweet, simple things of life which are the real ones after all.”
Author: Laura Ingalls Wilder

Quote: “Name the greatest of all inventors. Accident.”
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: “Literature is a luxury; fiction is a necessity.”
Author: G.K. Chesterton

Quote: “Do not set aside your happiness. Do not wait to be happy in the future. The best time to be happy is always now.”
Author: Roy T. Bennett

Quote: “My life has a superb cast, but I cannot figure out the plot.”
Author: Ashleigh Brilliant

Quote: “The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing. ”
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: “All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.”
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: “I think there should be a rule that everyone in the world should get a standing ovation at least once in their lives.”
Author: R.J. Palacio,

Quote: “The desire to reach for the stars is ambitious. The desire to reach hearts is wise.”
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: “I don't mind making jokes, but I don't want to look like one.”
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: “There's a bluebird in my heart that wants to get outbut I'm too tough for him,I say, stay in there, I'm not going to let anybody see you.”
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: “No good deed goes unpunished.”
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: “The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.”
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: “It stops here. With me and you. It ends with us.”
Author: Colleen Hoover,

Quote: “I am broken and healing, but every piece of my heart belong to you.”
Author: Sarah J. Maas,
Book: A Court of Mist and Fury

Quote: “We dream to give ourselves hope. To stop dreaming - well, that’s like saying you can never change your fate.”
Author: Amy Tan,

Quote: “The longer I live, the more I observe that carrying around anger is the most debilitating to the person who bears it.”
Author: Katharine Graham

Quote: “God alert! Blackjack yelled. It's the wine dude!Mr. D sighed in exasperation. The next person, or horse, who calls me the 'wine dude' will end up in a bottle of Merlot!”
Author: Rick Riordan,

Quote: “Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise.”
Author: Margaret Atwood,

Quote: “Death is so terribly final, while life is full of possibilities.”
Author: George R.R. Martin,

Quote: “What is straight? A line can be straight, or a street, but the human heart, oh, no, it's curved like a road through mountains.”
Author: Tennessee Williams,

Quote: “...things get broken, and sometimes they get repaired, and in most cases, you realize that no matter what gets damaged, life rearranges itself to compensate for your loss, sometimes wonderfully.”
Author: Hanya Yanagihara,

Quote: “In one aspect, yes, I believe in ghosts, but we create them. We haunt ourselves.”
Author: Laurie Halse Anderson,

Quote: “The mass of men lead lives of quiet desperation. What is called resignation is confirmed desperation. From the desperate city you go into the desperate country, and have to console yourself with the bravery of minks and muskrats. A stereotyped but unconscious despair is concealed even under what ar...
Author: Henry David Thoreau,

Quote: “If books could have more, give more, be more, show more, they would still need readers who bring to them sound and smell and light and all the rest that can’t be in books.	The book needs you.”
Author: Gary Paulsen,

Quote: “However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on upon them?”
Author: Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

Quote: “I guess that's what saying good-bye is always like--like jumping off an edge. The worst part is making the choice to do it. Once you're in the air, there's nothing you can do but let go.”
Author: Lauren Oliver,

Quote: “Unfortunately, the clock is ticking, the hours are going by. The past increases, the future recedes. Possibilities decreasing, regrets mounting.”
Author: Haruki Murakami,

Quote: “The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.”
Author: Confucius,

Quote: “For to know a man's library is, in some measure, to know his mind.”
Author: Geraldine Brooks,

Quote: “Good sex is like good bridge. If you don't have a good partner, you'd better have a good hand.”
Author: Mae West

Quote: “If you win, you need not have to explain...If you lose, you should not be there to explain!”
Author: Adolf Hitler

Quote: “One should always be drunk. That's all that matters...But with what? With wine, with poetry, or with virtue, as you chose. But get drunk.”
Author: Charles Baudelaire,

Quote: “Music is ... A higher revelation than all Wisdom & Philosophy”
Author: Ludwig van Beethoven

Quote: “Love is like a tree: it grows by itself, roots itself deeply in our being and continues to flourish over a heart in ruin. The inexplicable fact is that the blinder it is, the more tenacious it is. It is never stronger than when it is completely unreasonable.”
Author: Victor Hugo,

Quote: “I’m on a roller coaster that only goes up, my friend.”
Author: John Green,

Quote: “He allowed himself to be swayed by his conviction that human beings are not born once and for all on the day their mothers give birth to them, but that life obliges them over and over again to give birth to themselves.”
Author: Gabriel García Márquez,
Book: Love in the Time of Cholera

Quote: “The unfed mind devours itself.”
Author: Gore Vidal

Quote: “Without you in my arms, I feel an emptiness in my soul. I find myself searching the crowds for your face - I know it's an impossibility, but I cannot help myself.”
Author: Nicholas Sparks,

Quote: “I love you as certain dark things are loved, secretly, between the shadow and the soul.”
Author: Pablo Neruda,

Quote: “The role of a writer is not to say what we can all say, but what we are unable to say.”
Author: Anais Nin

Quote: “Children learn more from what you are than what you teach.”
Author: W.E.B. DuBois

Quote: “Demon pox, oh demon poxJust how is it acquired?One must go down to the bad part of townUntil one is very tired.Demon pox, oh demon pox, I had it all along—Not the pox, you foolish blocks,I mean this very song—For I was right, and you were wrong!Will! Charlotte shouted over the noise, Have you LOST ...
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quote: “How do I love thee? Let me count the ways.I love thee to the depth and breadth and heightMy soul can reach”
Author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

Quote: “What draws people to be friends is that they see the same truth. They share it.”
Author: C. S. Lewis

Quote: “The course of true love never did run smooth; But, either it was different in blood,O cross! too high to be enthrall’d to low. Or else misgraffed in respect of years, O spite! too old to be engag’d to young. Or else it stood upon the choice of friends,O hell! to choose love by another’s eye.”
Author: William Shakespeare,

Quote: “Crows remember human faces. They remember the people who feed them, who are kind to them. And the people who wrong them too. They don’t forget. They tell each other who to look after and who to watch out for.”
Author: Leigh Bardugo,

Quote: “Sex is part of nature. I go along with nature.”
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: “If you're texting Magnus to say 'I think u r kewl,' I'm going to kill you.Who's Magnus? Max inquired.He's a warlock, said Alec.A sexy, sexy warlock, Isabelle told Max, ignoring Alec's look of total fury.But warlocks are bad, protested Max, looking baffled.Exactly, said Isabelle.”
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quote: “She was a genius of sadness, immersing herself in it, separating its numerous strands, appreciating its subtle nuances. She was a prism through which sadness could be divided into its infinite spectrum.”
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,

Quote: “The greatness of a nation and its moral progress can be judged by the way its animals are treated.”
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: “Well, she's not responding to my advances, he observed more brightly than he felt, so she must be dead. Or she's a woman of good taste and sense.”
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quote: “Now that she had nothing to lose, she was free.”
Author: Paulo Coelho,

Quote: “Of course motivation is not permanent. But then, neither is bathing; but it is something you should do on a regular basis.”
Author: Zig Ziglar,
Book: Raising Positive Kids in a Negative World

Quote: “There is nothing more deceptive than an obvious fact.”
Author: Arthur Conan Doyle,
Book: The Boscombe Valley Mystery - a Sherlock Holmes Short Story

Quote: “I suffer from girlnextdooritis where the guy is friends with you and that's it.”
Author: Taylor Swift

Quote: “I know how devastated you must be to miss me, but leave a message, and I'll try to ease your agony”
Author: Richelle Mead,

Quote: “The sunlight claps the earth, and the moonbeams kiss the sea: what are all these kissings worth, if thou kiss not me?”
Author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

Quote: “Life is a mirror: if you frown at it, it frowns back; if you smile, it returns the greeting.”
Author: William Makepeace Thackeray

Quote: “The things we love destroy us every time, lad. Remember that.”
Author: George R.R. Martin,

Quote: “Imagination is like a muscle. I found out that the more I wrote, the bigger it got.”
Author: Philip José Farmer

Quote: “Freedom (n.): To ask nothing. To expect nothing. To depend on nothing.”
Author: Ayn Rand,

Quote: “With enough courage, you can do without a reputation.”
Author: Margaret Mitchell

Quote: “You believe in a book that has talking animals, wizards, witches, demons, sticks turning into snakes, burning bushes, food falling from the sky, people walking on water, and all sorts of magical, absurd and primitive stories, and you say that we are the ones that need help?”
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: “Listen with curiosity. Speak with honesty. Act with integrity. The greatest problem with communication is we don’t listen to understand. We listen to reply. When we listen with curiosity, we don’t listen with the intent to reply. We listen for what’s behind the words.”
Author: Roy T. Bennett,

Quote: “Women want love to be a novel. Men, a short story.”
Author: Daphne du Maurier

Quote: “We dream in our waking moments, and walk in our sleep.”
Author: Nathaniel Hawthorne,

Quote: “There will be a few times in your life when all your instincts will tell you to do something, something that defies logic, upsets your plans, and may seem crazy to others. When that happens, you do it. Listen to your instincts and ignore everything else. Ignore logic, ignore the odds, ignore the co...
Author: Judith McNaught,

Quote: “The mountains are calling and I must go.”
Author: John Muir

Quote: “Talking to a drunk person was like talking to an extremely happy, severely brain-damaged three-year-old.”
Author: John Green,

Quote: “But until a person can say deeply and honestly, I am what I am today because of the choices I made yesterday, that person cannot say, I choose otherwise.”
Author: Stephen R. Covey,
Book: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People: Powerful Lessons in Personal Change

Quote: “To die, it's easy. But you have to struggle for life.”
Author: Art Spiegelman,
Book: Maus I: A Survivor's Tale: My Father Bleeds History

Quote: “Nobody gets everything in this life. You decide your priorities and you make your choices. I'd decided long ago that any cake I had would be eaten.”
Author: Donald E. Westlake,

Quote: “If you are a student you should always get a good nights sleep unless you have come to the good part of your book, and then you should stay up all night and let your schoolwork fall by the wayside, a phrase which means 'flunk'.”
Author: Lemony Snicket

Quote: “The most terrible poverty is loneliness, and the feeling of being unloved.”
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: “What is a person, if not the marks they leave behind?”
Author: V.E. Schwab,
Book: The Invisible Life of Addie LaRue

Quote: “If you stay, I'll do whatever you want. I'll quit the band, go with you to New York. But if you need me to go away, I'll do that, too. I was talking to Liz and she said maybe coming back to your old life would be too painful, that maybe it'd be easier for you to erase us. And that would suck, but I...
Author: Gayle Forman,

Quote: “A concept is a brick. It can be used to build a courthouse of reason. Or it can be thrown through the window.”
Author: Gilles Deleuze,
Book: A Thousand Plateaus: Capitalism and Schizophrenia

Quote: “Some things in life are out of your control. You can make it a party or a tragedy.”
Author: Nora Roberts,

Quote: “Too many of us are hung up on what we don't have, can't have, or won't ever have. We spend too much energy being down, when we could use that same energy – if not less of it – doing, or at least trying to do, some of the things we really want to do.”
Author: Terry McMillan ,

Quote: “So light a fire! Harry choked. Yes...of course...but there's no wood! ... HAVE YOU GONE MAD! Ron bellowed. ARE YOU A WITCH OR NOT!”
Author: J.K. Rowling,
Book: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

Quote: “Gus: It tastes like...Me: Food.Gus: Yes, precisely. It tastes like food, excellently prepared. But it does not taste, how do I put this delicately...?Me: It does not taste like God Himself cooked heaven into a series of five dishes which were then served to you accompanied by several luminous balls...
Author: John Green,

Quote: “I'm happy. Which often looks like crazy.”
Author: David Henry Hwang,

Quote: “Being with you never felt wrong. It's the one thing I did right. You're the one thing I did right.”
Author: Becca Fitzpatrick,

Quote: “I never forget a face, but in your case I'll be glad to make an exception.”
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: “I decided it is better to scream. Silence is the real crime against humanity.”
Author: Nadezhda Mandelstam,

Quote: “If there's one thing I've learned, it's this: We all want everything to be okay. We don't even wish so much for fantastic or marvelous or outstanding. We will happily settle for okay, because most of the time, okay is enough.”
Author: David Levithan,

Quote: “How happy is the blameless vestal’s lot!The world forgetting, by the world forgot.Eternal sunshine of the spotless mind!Each pray’r accepted, and each wish resign’d”
Author: Alexander Pope,

Quote: “You - you alone will have the stars as no one else has them...In one of the stars I shall be living. In one of them I shall be laughing. And so it will be as if all the stars were laughing, when you look at the sky at night...You - only you - will have stars that can laugh.”
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,

Quote: “Lord, what fools these mortals be!”
Author: William Shakespeare,

Quote: “A short story is a different thing altogether – a short story is like a quick kiss in the dark from a stranger.”
Author: Stephen King,

Quote: “Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love.”
Author: Charles M. Schulz

Quote: “A girl calls and asks, Does it hurt very much to die?Well, sweetheart, I tell her, yes, but it hurts a lot more to keep living.”
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,

Quote: “Let no one ever come to you without leaving better and happier. Be the living expression of God's kindness: kindness in your face, kindness in your eyes, kindness in your smile.”
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: “You could say sorry, suggested Harry bluntly. What, and get attacked by another flock of canaries? muttered Ron.What did you have to imitate her for?She laughed at my mustache!So did I, it was the stupidest thing I've ever seen.”
Author: J.K. Rowling,
Book: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

Quote: “True friends are always together in spirit.”
Author: L.M. Montgomery,

Quote: “It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one.”
Author: George Washington

Quote: “One could not count the moons that shimmer on her roofs,Or the thousand splendid suns that hide behind her walls.”
Author: Khaled Hosseini,

Quote: “That which you believe becomes your world.”
Author: Richard Matheson,

Quote: “When you read a book, you hold another's mind in your hands.”
Author: James Burke

Quote: “Not everything that is faced can be changed, but nothing can be changed until it is faced.”
Author: James Baldwin

Quote: “Have you tried talking to her? No. We've been punching her in the face repeatedly. What? You don't think that will work?”
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quote: “After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relations.”
Author: Oscar Wilde,

Quote: “Why do beautiful songs make you sad?' 'Because they aren't true.' 'Never?' 'Nothing is beautiful and true.”
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,

Quote: “The mystery of life isn't a problem to solve, but a reality to experience.”
Author: Frank Herbert,

Quote: “Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.”
Author: Confucius

Quote: “No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.”
Author: Charles Dickens

Quote: “I guess by now I should know enough about loss to realize that you never really stop missing someone-you just learn to live around the huge gaping hole of their absence.”
Author: Alyson Noel,

Quote: “My religion is very simple. My religion is kindness.”
Author: Dalai Lama XIV

Quote: “Will rolled up his sleeves. We'll probably have to knock down the door-- Or, said Jem, reaching out and giving the knob a twist, not. The door swung open onto a rectangle of darkness. Now, that's simply laziness, said Will.”
Author: Cassandra Clare,

Quote: “We do not remember days, we remember moments.”
Author: Jennifer Niven,

Quote: “There is no such thing as a broken family. Family is family, and is not determined by marriage certificates, divorce papers, and adoption documents. Families are made in the heart. The only time family becomes null is when those ties in the heart are cut. If you cut those ties, those people are not...
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: “Humor is reason gone mad.”
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: “What is honor compared to a woman's love? What is duty against the feel of a newborn son in your arms . . . or the memory of a brother's smile? Wind and words. Wind and words. We are only human, and the gods have fashioned us for love. That is our great glory, and our great tragedy.”
Author: George R.R. Martin,

Quote: “So it’s true, when all is said and done, grief is the price we pay for love.”
Author: E.A. Bucchianeri,

Quote: “Throw your dreams into space like a kite, and you do not know what it will bring back, a new life, a new friend, a new love, a new country.”
Author: Anais Nin

Quote: “To survive, you must tell stories.”
Author: Umberto Eco,
Book: The Island of the Day Before

Quote: “I hope you find someone you can't live without.I really do. And I hope you never have to know what it's like to have to try and live without them.”
Author: Kiera Cass,

Quote: “Sometimes, the best way to help someone is just to be near them.”
Author: Veronica Roth,

Quote: “I am not an angel,' I asserted; 'and I will not be one till I die: I will be myself. Mr. Rochester, you must neither expect nor exact anything celestial of me - for you will not get it, any more than I shall get it of you: which I do not at all anticipate.”
Author: Charlotte Brontë,

Quote: “The easy confidence with which I know another man's religion is folly teaches me to suspect that my own is also.”
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: “But I believe in true love, you know? I don't believe that everybody gets to keep their eyes or not get sick or whatever, but everybody should have true love, and it should last at least as long as your life does.”
Author: John Green,

Quote: “You get what anybody gets - you get a lifetime.”
Author: Neil Gaiman,

Quote: “Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.”
Author: Steve Maraboli,
Book: Life, the Truth, and Being Free

Quote: “The thought of suicide is a great consolation: by means of it one gets through many a dark night.”
Author: Nietzsche

Quote: “Always be a first rate version of yourself and not a second rate version of someone else.”
Author: Judy Garland

Quote: “What do you fear, lady? [Aragorn] asked. A cage, [Éowyn] said. To stay behind bars, until use and old age accept them, and all chance of doing great deeds is gone beyond recall or desire.”
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,

Quote: “This is where it all begins. Everything starts here, today.”
Author: David Nicholls,

Quote: “There is a saying in Tibetan, 'Tragedy should be utilized as a source of strength.'No matter what sort of difficulties, how painful experience is, if we lose our hope, that's our real disaster.”
Author: Dalai Lama XIV

Quote: “Morality is simply the attitude we adopt towards people we personally dislike.”
Author: Oscar Wilde,

Quote: “So we shall let the reader answer this question for himself: who is the happier man, he who has braved the storm of life and lived or he who has stayed securely on shore and merely existed?”
Author: Hunter S. Thompson

Quote: “Adults are always asking little kids what they want to be when they grow up ’cause they’re looking for ideas.”
Author: Paula Poundstone

Quote: “She looked at nice young men as if she could smell their stupidity.”
Author: Flannery O'Connor

Quote: “When you go into the ER, one of the first things they ask you to do is rate your pain on a scale of one to ten, and from there they decide which drugs to use and how quickly to use them. I'd been asked this question hundreds of times over the years, and I remember once early on when I couldn't get ...
Author: John Green,

Quote: “Don't waste your love on somebody, who doesn't value it.”
Author: William Shakespeare,

Quote: “Some things are more precious because they don't last long.”
Author: Oscar Wilde,

Quote: “In the world I amAlways a strangerI do not understand its languageIt does not understand my silence”
Author: Bei Dao

Quote: “Ask for what you want and be prepared to get it!”
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: “Man often becomes what he believes himself to be. If I keep on saying to myself that I cannot do a certain thing, it is possible that I may end by really becoming incapable of doing it. On the contrary, if I have the belief that I can do it, I shall surely acquire the capacity to do it even if I ma...
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: “The Darkling slumped back in his chair. “Fine,” he said with a weary shrug. “Make me your villain.”
Author: Leigh Bardugo,

Quote: “It was the best of times, it was the worst of times, it was the age of wisdom, it was the age of foolishness, it was the epoch of belief, it was the epoch of incredulity, it was the season of light, it was the season of darkness, it was the spring of hope, it was the winter of despair.”
Author: Charles Dickens,

Quote: “When we are children we seldom think of the future. This innocence leaves us free to enjoy ourselves as few adults can. The day we fret about the future is the day we leave our childhood behind.”
Author: Patrick Rothfuss,

Quote: “Sometimes you lose a battle. But mischief always wins the war”
Author: John Green,

Quote: “I have not broken your heart - you have broken it; and in breaking it, you have broken mine.”
Author: Emily Brontë,

Quote: “Sleep, those little slices of death — how I loathe them.”
Author: Edgar Allan Poe

Quote: “Poetry is what happens when nothing else can.”
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: “Reading is like thinking, like praying, like talking to a friend, like expressing your ideas, like listening to other people's ideas, like listening to music, like looking at the view, like taking a walk on the beach.”
Author: Roberto Bolaño,

Quote: “There are perhaps many causes worth dying for, but to me, certainly, there are none worth killing for.”
Author: Albert Dietrich,
Book: Army GI, Pacifist CO: The World War II Letters of Frank Dietrich and Albert Dietrich

Quote: “You never know what life is like, until you have lived it.”
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: “What is that feeling when you're driving away from people and they recede on the plain till you see their specks dispersing? - it's the too-huge world vaulting us, and it's good-bye. But we lean forward to the next crazy venture beneath the skies.”
Author: Jack Kerouac,

Quote: “Have I told you how hideous you look tonight?” Cardan asks, leaning back in the elaborately carved chair, the warmth of his words turning the question into something like a compliment.“No” I say, glad to be annoyed back into the present. “Tell me.”I can't.”
Author: Holly Black,

Quote: “You may tell a tale that takes up residence in someone's soul, becomes their blood and self and purpose. That tale will move them and drive them and who knows that they might do because of it, because of your words. That is your role, your gift.”
Author: Erin Morgenstern,

Quote: “Poetry is what gets lost in translation.”
Author: Robert Frost

Quote: “Every weirdo in the world is on my wavelength.”
Author: Thomas Pynchon

Quote: “We live as we dream--alone....”
Author: Joseph Conrad,

Quote: “Of course I’ll hurt you. Of course you’ll hurt me. Of course we will hurt each other. But this is the very condition of existence. To become spring, means accepting the risk of winter. To become presence, means accepting the risk of absence.”
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,

Quote: “I feel like someone breathed new air into my lungs. I am not Abnegation. I am not Dauntless. I am Divergent.”
Author: Veronica Roth,

Quote: “I'm always happy, Sasha said. Sometimes I just forget.”
Author: Jennifer Egan,
Book: A Visit from the Goon Squad

Quote: “That's the thing about girls. Every time they do something pretty, even if they're not much to look at, or even if they're sort of stupid, you fall in love with them, and then you never know where the hell you are. Girls. Jesus Christ. They can drive you crazy. They really can.”
Author: J.D. Salinger,

Quote: “We don’t need a list of rights and wrongs, tables of dos and don’ts: we need books, time, and silence. Thou shalt not is soon forgotten, but Once upon a time lasts forever.”
Author: Philip Pullman

Quote: “Ideally, what should be said to every child, repeatedly, throughout his or her school life is something like this: 'You are in the process of being indoctrinated. We have not yet evolved a system of education that is not a system of indoctrination. We are sorry, but it is the best we can do. What y...
Author: Doris Lessing,

Quote: “The mind I love must have wild places.”
Author: Katherine Mansfield

Quote: “We are all born sexual creatures,thank God, but it's a pity so many people despise and crush this natural gift.”
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: “To give pleasure to a single heart by a single act is better than a thousand heads bowing in prayer.”
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: “I want everyone to meet you. You're my favorite person of all time.”
Author: Rainbow Rowell,

Quote: “Every deep thinker is more afraid of being understood than of being misunderstood.”
Author: Friedrich Neitzsche

Quote: “Threats are the last resort of a man with no vocabulary.”
Author: Tamora Pierce,

Quote: “Imagination is everything. It is the preview of life's coming attractions.”
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: “Well, I must endure the presence of a few caterpillars if I wish to become acquainted with the butterflies.”
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,

Quote: “Others have seen what is and asked why. I have seen what could be and asked why not. ”
Author: Pablo Picasso,
Book: Pablo Picasso: Metamorphoses of the Human Form : Graphic Works, 1895-1972

Quote: “The starting point of all achievement is DESIRE. Keep this constantly in mind. Weak desire brings weak results, just as a small fire makes a small amount of heat.”
Author: Napoleon Hill,

Quote: “Because,' she said, 'when you're scared but you still do it anyway, that's brave.”
Author: Neil Gaiman,

Quote: “Learn the rules, break the rules, make up new rules, break the new rules.”
Author: Marvin Bell

Quote: “It's only those who do nothing that make no mistakes, I suppose.”
Author: Joseph Conrad,

Quote: “If I am not good to myself, how can I expect anyone else to be good to me?”
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: “I think and think and think, I‘ve thought myself out of happiness one million times, but never once into it.”
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer

Quote: “People are capable, at any time in their lives, of doing what they dream of.”
Author: Paulo Coelho,

Quote: “We should meet in another life, we should meet in air, me and you.”
Author: Sylvia Plath

Quote: “To lose balance sometimes for love is part of living a balancedlife.”
Author: Elizabeth Gilbert,
Book: Eat, Pray, Love: One Woman's Search for Everything

Quote: “If you want to be happy, be.”
Author: Tolstoy Leo

Quote: “When I'm good, I'm very good, but when I'm bad, I'm better. ”
Author: Mae West

Quote: “sex is the consolation you have when you can't have love”
Author: Gabriel García Márquez

Quote: “Dare to live the life you have dreamed for yourself. Go forward and make your dreams come true.”
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: “Please, my darling Inej, treasure of my heart, won’t you do me the honor of acquiring me a new hat?”
Author: Leigh Bardugo,

Quote: “A man should hear a little music, read a little poetry, and see a fine picture every day of his life, in order that worldly cares may not obliterate the sense of the beautiful which God has implanted in the human soul.”
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: “I talk to God but the sky is empty.”
Author: Sylvia Plath

Quote: “Life has no remote....get up and change it yourself!”
Author: Mark A. Cooper,

Quote: “I'm afraid that sometimes you'll play lonely games too. Games you can't win 'cause you'll play against you.”
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: “Man, when you lose your laugh you lose your footing.”
Author: Ken Kesey,
Book: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Quote: “This is what we call love. When you are loved, you can do anything in creation. When you are loved, there's no need at all to understand what's happening, because everything happens within you.”
Author: Paulo Coelho,

Quote: “You are too generous to trifle with me. If your feelings are still what they were last April, tell me so at once. My affections and wishes are unchanged; but one word from you will silence me on this subject for ever.”
Author: Jane Austen,

Quote: “The sad truth is the truth is sad.”
Author: Lemony Snicket,

Quote: “I just want you to know that you’re very special… and the only reason I’m telling you is that I don’t know if anyone else ever has.”
Author: Stephen Chbosky,
Book: The Perks of Being a Wallflower

Quote: “We are travelers on a cosmic journey,stardust,swirling and dancing in the eddies and whirlpools of infinity. Life is eternal. We have stopped for a moment to encounter each other, to meet, to love, to share.This is a precious moment. It is a little parenthesis in eternity.”
Author: Paulo Coelho,

Quote: “Peace cannot be kept by force; it can only be achieved by understanding.”
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: “What's terrible is to pretend that second-rate is first-rate. To pretend that you don't need love when you do; or you like your work when you know quite well you're capable of better.”
Author: Doris Lessing,

Quote: “Silly things do cease to be silly if they are done by sensible people in an impudent way.”
Author: Jane Austen,

Quote: “Help others without any reason and give without the expectation of receiving anything in return.”
Author: Roy T. Bennett,

Quote: “Sometimes it takes a good fall to really know where you stand”
Author: Hayley Williams

Quote: “I don't want to be married just to be married. I can't think of anything lonelier than spending the rest of my life with someone I can't talk to, or worse, someone I can't be silent with.”
Author: Mary Ann Shaffer,
Book: The Guernsey Literary and Potato Peel Pie Society

Quote: “I am going to take this bucket of water and pour it on the flames of hell, and then I am going to use this torch to burn down the gates of paradise so that people will not love God for want of heaven or fear of hell, but because He is God.”
Author: John Green,

Quote: “If everybody minded their own business, the world would go around a great deal faster than it does.”
Author: Lewis Caroll,
